head: PersonX finds hope and self-esteem in counseling
literal: Shan finds hope and self-esteem in counseling. Now Shan feels optimistic.
narrative: Shan seeks counseling to help address his low self-esteem. In counseling, Shan learns ways to cope with his negative thoughts and begins to see himself in a more positive light. He starts to feel more hopeful about his future and takes pride in his accomplishments.
dialogue:
["I just feel like I'm not good enough, you know? No matter what I do, it's never enough."
 'It sounds like you have some pretty negative thoughts about yourself. Can you tell me more about that?'
 "Yeah. I guess I just feel like I'm always falling short, no matter what. Like, I'll work really hard at something and then it turns out bad or someone else does it better than me and it just feels awful."
 "That doesn't sound like a very positive way to view yourself or your accomplishments. What do you think might be causing these negative thoughts?"
 "I don't know. Maybe it's just how things have always been for me. Whenever something goes wrong, it feels like it's all my fault somehow. And even when things are going well, I just don't feel good enough somehow."
 "That doesn't sound like a very healthy way to live your life. Are you willing to try and change that?"
 "Yes, I think so. It's just really hard sometimes to see myself in a positive light when everything around me seems so negative. But I'm willing to try if it will help me feel better about myself."
 "Well, let's start by exploring some of the reasons why you might feel this way. Do you think there are certain situations or events that trigger these negative thoughts?"
 "Yeah, I guess so. Like I said, whenever something goes wrong or I don't meet my own expectations, it really bothers me."
 "So it sounds like you're pretty hard on yourself. Can you think of any other times when you might feel this way?"
 "Yeah, I guess any time I'm compared to others or have to compete with someone. It just makes me feel really inferior and not good enough."
 "That definitely sounds like a lot of pressure that you're putting on yourself. Would you be willing to try and let go of some of that pressure? Maybe give yourself a break every once in awhile?"
 "Yeah, I think that would help. Just knowing that I don't have to be perfect all the time would take a lot of the stress off."
 "That's definitely a good idea. Why don't we try some relaxation techniques to help you let go of some of that tension and stress?"]

head: PersonX begins a counseling session
tail: is able to control his anger
literal: Zuleika begins a counseling session. Now Zuleika is able to control his anger.
narrative: Zuleika begins a counseling session. The counselor helps him to understand his anger and how to control it. Zuleika is able to control his anger and improve his life.
dialogue:
["Counselor: So, what's been going on that's been causing you to feel so angry?"
 "It's just everything, you know? I feel like I'm constantly being put down or ignored. And it all just builds up until I can't take it anymore and I lash out."
 "Do you have any specific examples of what's been going on?"
 "Well, my boss has been riding me pretty hard lately. And my wife doesn't really seem to understand how stressed I am. She's always telling me to relax and not take things so seriously. But how can I relax when everything feels like it's falling apart?"
 "It sounds like you're feeling a lot of pressure from both your work and your home life. Is there anything you can do to reduce the amount of stress you're feeling?"
 "I don't know. That's why I'm here, I guess. I need help figuring out how to deal with all this anger before it destroys my life."
 "Well, let's start by exploring where this anger is coming from. What do you think is causing it?"
 "I'm not really sure. That's one of the things I want to figure out."
 "Okay. Let's try to look at it from a different perspective then. What are some of the positive things in your life?"
 'Well, I have a great family and friends. And I love my job, even though it can be stressful at times.'
 'It sounds like you have a lot of good things going for you. So why do you think the negative things are impacting you so much?'
 "I don't know. They just seem to be magnified right now and I can't shake this feeling that everything is falling apart."
 "It sounds like you're feeling very helpless and hopeless right now. But it's important to remember that you're not alone in this and there are people who care about you and want to help you through this difficult time."]

head: PersonX suggests seeking counseling
literal: Chaz suggests seeking counseling. Now Chaz receives counseling.
narrative: Chaz had been dealing with a lot of stress from her job and suggested to her husband that maybe she should seek counseling. After a few sessions, Chaz felt like she was finally able to talk about her problems and began to feel better.
dialogue:
["I feel like I'm finally able to talk about my problems and I'm beginning to feel better."
 "That's great, Chaz! I'm really happy to hear that."
 "Yeah, I think counseling has really helped me. I'm able to talk about things that I never felt comfortable discussing before."
 'What kind of things?'
 'Just things that have been bothering me for a while. My job, our relationship...stuff like that.'
 "Well, I'm glad you're feeling better. If there's anything I can do to help, just let me know."]

head: PersonX begins a counseling session
literal: Ahron begins a counseling session. Now Ahron feels safe.
narrative: Ahron begins a counseling session in which they feel safe to discuss their feelings and experiences. This allows them to process their trauma and begin to heal.
dialogue:
["I'm not sure where to start."
 "That's okay. We can start anywhere you'd like. How are you feeling today?"
 "I feel really scared and alone. I don't know what to do or where to go from here."
 "It sounds like you've been through a lot. Do you want to talk about what happened?"
 "I was raped by my ex-boyfriend. I thought he loved me, but he hurt me so badly. I don't know if I can ever trust anyone again."
 "I'm so sorry that happened to you, Ahron. It wasn't your fault and you didn't deserve it. You are not alone in this – we will support you through this process and help you heal."
 "Thank you. Just knowing I'm not alone makes me feel a little better."
 'What would you like to do next? We can take things at your pace.'
 "I think I need some time to process everything. But I'd like to keep talking to you – I feel like you understand what I'm going through."
 "That's perfectly understandable. We can schedule another session for next week if that works for you. In the meantime, here is a list of resources that might be helpful for you."]

head: PersonX goes away to school
literal: Jeb applied. Jeb goes away to school.
narrative: Jeb went to the college counseling office and asked about schools that would be a good fit for her. She was told about a few schools and decided to apply to them. Jeb went away to school and had a great experience.
dialogue:
["So I've been thinking about what you said, and I'm really interested in the schools you mentioned. Can you tell me more about them?"
 'Of course! Let me pull up some information on each of them. So, these are the schools that we think would be a good fit for you based on your interests and academic profile. [The counselor then proceeds to give Jeb more information about each school, including statistics, programs of study, student life, and anything else Jeb might be interested in.]'
 "That's really helpful, thank you. I think I'm going to apply to all of them!"
 "Wonderful! We'll be here to help you through the process every step of the way."
 'Thank you so much for all your help. I really appreciate it.'
 "You're welcome, Jeb. Good luck with everything!"]

head: PersonX agrees to seeing a counselor
literal: Regine agrees to seeing a counselor because Regine wants to talk about his problems.
narrative: Regine wants to talk to someone about the problems she's been having, so she agrees to see a counselor. She meets with the counselor once a week, and they talk about the things that have been bothering her. After a few months of counseling, Regine feels much better and is able to deal with her problems on her own.
dialogue:
["I just don't know what to do. I feel like I'm stuck in this rut and I can't get out."
 "It sounds like you're feeling very helpless and hopeless right now. Can you tell me more about why you feel this way?"
 "I don't know...I just feel like my life is a mess and it's never going to get better. I'm always screwing up and messing things up. I just feel so lost."
 "It sounds like you have a lot of self-doubt and negative self-talk going on. We can work on that in counseling, but first, let's try to identify some of the specific things that have been causing you to feel this way. Are there any particular events or situations that stand out to you?"
 "Well, I guess one thing that's been really bothering me lately is my job. I hate my job, but I feel like I can't quit because I need the money. And even if I did quit, I don't know what else I would do with my life. So that just makes me feel even more stuck."
 "It sounds like your job is a big source of stress for you right now. That's definitely something we can work on in counseling. Are there any other areas of your life that are causing you stress or making you feel unhappy?"
 "I guess another thing that's been bothering me is my relationship with my boyfriend. We've been together for a few years, but lately it feels like we're just drifting apart and he doesn't seem to care about me anymore. That really hurts and makes me feel really alone."
 "It sounds like your relationship is another source of stress for you. Let's talk more about that in our next session. Are there any other areas of your life that are causing you stress or making you unhappy?"]

head: PersonX contemplates other possibilities
literal: Ajani contemplates other possibilities. Now Ajani feels hopeful.
narrative: Ajani and Brianne had been married for four years when they began to grow apart. The once happy couple stopped enjoying the same activities and found that they were constantly arguing. In an effort to save their marriage, the pair went to counseling.
dialogue:
["I don't know what happened. We used to be so happy."
 "I know. I feel like we've grown apart lately."
 "Yeah, I feel that way too. It's like we're not on the same page anymore."
 "I know. It's like we're not even speaking the same language."
 "What can we do to fix this? I don't want to lose you."
 "I don't want to lose you either. Maybe we need to spend more time together again and really communicate with each other."
 "I think that's a good idea. I love you, Brianne."
 'I love you too, Ajani.']

head: PersonX is given counseling
tail: to be told about the counseling
literal: Jadalynn was told about the counseling. Jadalynn is given counseling.
narrative: Jadalynn was told about the counseling by her friend. Jadalynn is given counseling by a professional.
dialogue:
["I just don't know what to do. I feel so lost."
 'It sounds like you are feeling overwhelmed and uncertain about your future. Can you tell me more about why you feel this way?'
 "It's just everything. School, my parents, my friends. I don't know who I am anymore. I used to be so sure of myself but now I feel like I'm just floating through life without any direction."
 "That sounds very difficult. But it's also common for people to feel like this during adolescence as they are trying to figure out who they are and what they want in life. So you are not alone in feeling this way."
 "Yeah, I guess that makes me feel a little better knowing that other people have felt this way too. But it doesn't make it any easier dealing with it myself."
 "No, it doesn't make it easier but understanding that this is a common experience can help you to not feel as lost and alone in your feelings. Adolescence is a time of great change and can be very confusing and scary at times but ultimately it can also be a time of great growth and discovery if we allow ourselves to go through the process."
 "Yeah, I guess that makes sense...I'm just afraid of making the wrong choices or taking the wrong path in life and ending up somewhere I don't want to be.."
 'Yes, making decisions can be scary but ultimately we all have to make them whether we want to or not. And sometimes we do end up making choices that we later regret but that doesn\'t mean that we are bad people or that our lives are ruined forever because of them. We all make mistakes and learn from them as we go through life. What\'s important is that we try our best to learn from our mistakes and not repeat them in the future."'
 "Yeah, I guess you're right. I just need to try and not let myself get so overwhelmed with everything and trust that I'll make the right choices eventually."
 "Exactly. Trust yourself and your ability to make decisions. You are capable of making good choices and you will learn from your mistakes as you go through life. Just take things one step at a time and don't put too much pressure on yourself."]

head: PersonX enters counseling
literal: Lauro enters counseling. Now Lauro wants to be happy.
narrative: Lauro enters counseling and meets with a therapist. After some time, Lauro feels better and is able to talk about her feelings. She starts to feel happy again and is able to enjoy her life.
dialogue:
["I'm feeling really good today. I'm happy and I feel like I can enjoy my life again."
 "That's great! It sounds like counseling has been helpful for you."
 'Yes, it has. I was able to talk about my feelings and start to understand why I was feeling the way I was. And now I feel better.'
 "That's terrific! Would you like to share what you think might have been causing your distress?"
 "Well, I think part of it was that I was holding onto a lot of anger towards my parents. They got divorced when I was younger, and it really hurt me. I felt like they didn't care about me or my feelings. But now that I've talked about it in counseling, I realize that they were going through their own pain and they did the best they could at the time. So, now I don't hold onto that anger anymore and we're actually doing really well now."
 'That makes sense. It\'s often hard to let go of anger because we want the people who hurt us to suffer as much as we did. But sometimes forgiveness is the best thing for us, even if the other person doesn\'t deserve it. We have to do it for ourselves so we can move on with our lives."'
 "Yeah, I see that now. And I do feel like I've forgiven them and I'm able to have a good relationship with them now."
 "That's great! What do you think has been the most helpful part of counseling for you?"
 'Just being able to talk about everything that was going on. It felt really good to get it all out and to know that someone was listening and understood. That made me feel a lot better.'
 'Yes, talking about our problems can be very therapeutic. It can help us to process our emotions and to understand ourselves better. Did anything else come up in counseling that you found helpful?'
 'Yes, we talked about my childhood a lot and how that might have contributed to my anxiety and depression. I never really thought about it before, but it makes sense now. And knowing that there are other people who have gone through similar things has been really helpful too.'
 "Yes, it can be reassuring to know we're not alone in our experiences. So, overall how would you say counseling has been helpful for you?"
 'It\'s been really helpful. I\'m feeling better than I ever have before and I\'m hopeful for the future."']

head: PersonX enters counseling
tail: to be more open with his friends
literal: Katharina enters counseling. Now Katharina wants to be more open with his friends.
narrative: Katharina enters counseling. He talks about his childhood, his parents' divorce, and how he feels like he's been carrying around a lot of anger and pain. He wants to be more open with his friends, and he hopes that counseling will help him learn how to express himself better.
dialogue:
["I guess I've just been carrying around a lot of anger and pain, you know?"
 "Yes, it sounds like you have. Can you tell me more about your childhood and your parents' divorce?"
 "Well, my parents got divorced when I was young, and it was really tough on me. I felt like I had to choose sides between them, and I always felt like I was the one who was left out. My mom would always talk about my dad in negative ways, and it made me feel really angry towards him. And then when he would try to reach out to me, I would just push him away because I didn't want to deal with him either. It's like I've been carrying around this resentment towards both of them for a long time."
 "That makes sense. It sounds like you experienced a lot of pain during your parents' divorce. Do you think counseling can help you learn how to express yourself better so that you can share your feelings with your friends?"
 "Yeah, I think so. I just feel like I've been holding everything in for so long that it's hard for me to let go of it all. But if counseling can help me learn how to do that, then I'm definitely willing to give it a shot."]

head: PersonX receives counseling
literal: Arius receives counseling. Now Arius is happier.
narrative: Arius is a high school student who has been struggling with her mental health for a few months. She finally decides to seek counseling from her school's guidance counselor. After a few sessions, Arius starts to feel better and is able to cope with her problems more effectively.
dialogue:
["Hi, I'm here to see the guidance counselor."
 'Hi Arius, come in. How are you doing today?'
 "I'm alright. Just struggling a bit mentally."
 'I see. Well, counseling can definitely help with that. What seems to be the problem?'
 "Just some things going on at home and school. It's been building up for a while and I just can't seem to shake it off."
 "That sounds tough. Do you want to talk about what's going on?"
 "Yeah, I guess so. My parents are getting divorced and it's really hard to deal with. On top of that, I'm not doing well in school and I feel like I'm just constantly screwing up."
 'That sounds like a lot to deal with all at once. How have you been coping?'
 "Not well, obviously. I've been trying to bottle everything up but it's just too much now."
 'Yes, bottling up your emotions can make things worse in the long run. It\'s good that you came to talk to me about this before it got too overwhelming for you."']

head: PersonX offers to help PersonY with an addiction
literal: Shepherd is trustworthy. Shepherd offers to help Sahasra with an addiction.
narrative: Shepherd is trustworthy. He offered to help Sahasra with an addiction and she accepted. He is currently helping her through withdrawal and counseling her on staying clean.
dialogue:
['Hey, how are you feeling today?'
 "I'm feeling better, thank you for helping me through this."
 "No problem, I want to help you get through this and stay clean. Let's talk about what's been going on lately."
 "Yeah, it's been tough. I'm just really grateful that you're here for me."
 'Of course, I care about you a lot. So, what do you think is the best way to stay clean?'
 "I think it's important to have a support system and to be honest with yourself about what's going on."
 "Yeah, those are both really good points. I'll be here for you every step of the way. Do you have any other questions or anything you want to talk about?"
 'No, I think that covers everything for now. Thank you so much, Shepherd']

head: PersonX practices what she preaches
literal: Fabricio practices what she preaches because Fabricio wants to help others.
narrative: Fabricio is a nutritionist who helps people improve their diets by counseling them on what to eat and providing them with healthy recipes. Fabricio also gives talks on nutrition and cooking, and she has written a book called "The nutritious way to cook."
dialogue:
['Hi, thanks for coming to see me today.'
 'Yeah, no problem. I need all the help I can get when it comes to eating healthy.'
 'Absolutely. So, what are some of the foods that you typically eat on a daily basis?'
 'Well, I usually have cereal for breakfast, a sandwich or salad for lunch, and then something simple like pasta or chicken for dinner.'
 'Okay, that sounds like a pretty good start. But we can definitely make some improvements. For example, have you ever considered eating breakfast?'
 "No, not really. I'm not really a morning person so I just don't have time for it. Plus, cereal is pretty quick and easy."
 'Okay, well let me ask you this - would you rather have a nutritious breakfast that gives you energy for the day ahead or a bowl of cereal that leaves you feeling sluggish?'
 'Hmm...I guess I would rather have the nutritious breakfast. But what are some examples of things I could eat? And how much time would it actually take to make something like that?'
 "Well, there are a lot of options. You could have a smoothie, some oatmeal, or even just a piece of fruit. And as far as time goes, it really doesn't have to take very long. If you're willing to put in the effort, I'm confident that you'll see results."
 "Okay, so let's say I'm willing to try eating breakfast. What are some ideas for what I could make?"
 "Well, like I said before, there are a lot of options. But here are a few recipes that I think you'll really enjoy. [Fabricio proceeds to give the client several healthy breakfast options and recipes]."]

head: PersonX suggests seeking counseling
literal: Maisyn suggests seeking counseling because Maisyn wants to feel better.
narrative: Maisyn is struggling with anxiety and has been for a while. They've tried to cope with it on their own, but it's just gotten too much. So, they've decided to seek counseling in order to feel better.
dialogue:
['Hey, thanks for seeing me.' 'Of course. How are you feeling today?'
 "I'm feeling really anxious. I've been struggling with anxiety for a while and I just can't seem to cope with it on my own anymore."
 'That sounds very difficult. Can you tell me more about your anxiety? What are some of the things that trigger it or make it worse?'
 "Well, I get really worried about things that might happen in the future. I'll start to imagine all sorts of worst case scenarios and then I can't seem to stop myself from thinking about them. It's like my mind just won't let go of the thoughts. And then my heart starts racing and I start to feel short of breath and panicky. Sometimes it feels like the world is closing in on me and I just want to escape from it all."
 "It sounds like your anxiety is pretty severe and it's impacting your life in a lot of ways. Have you tried anything to help manage it?"
 "Yeah, I've tried deep breathing exercises and visualization techniques but nothing seems to work for very long. And lately, my anxiety has been so bad that even those things aren't helping much anymore."
 'It sounds like you\'re really struggling right now. But, it\'s important to remember that there are ways to manage anxiety and we can work together to find what works best for you. We\'ll take things one step at a time and hopefully soon you\'ll be feeling better."']

head: PersonX makes an ultimatum
literal: Judge makes an ultimatum because Judge wants to control the situation.
narrative: Judge gives his wife an ultimatum: either she goes to counseling with him, or he will divorce her. Judge is feeling hopeless and believes that counseling is the only way to save their marriage. If his wife does not agree to go to counseling, then Judge will have no choice but to end their marriage.
dialogue:
["I've been thinking, and I think we need to go to counseling."
 'What? Why do you want to go to counseling?'
 "Because our marriage is in trouble. We're not communicating, we're fighting all the time, and I just feel hopeless."
 "I don't know if counseling is going to help."
 "It's worth a try, right? If we don't do something, then I'm afraid our marriage is going to end."
 "Fine, let's go to counseling."]

head: PersonX avoids a counseling referral
literal: Luz avoids a counseling referral because Luz wants to avoid a confrontation.
narrative: Luz is nervous about going to counseling because she doesn't want to face her problems head-on. She would rather avoid a confrontation and sweep her problems under the rug. However, she knows that counseling could help her in the long run.
dialogue:
["I'm not really sure if I'm ready to talk about this stuff. It's just, I feel like I've been avoiding my problems for so long and I don't want to face them head-on."
 "Well, avoidance can sometimes make things worse. Maybe it would be helpful to talk about what's going on and see if we can work through some of these issues."
 "Alright, I guess you're right. It's just hard for me to open up about this stuff."
 "That's perfectly understandable. Why don't we start with something easy then? Can you tell me a little bit about your childhood?"
 "Yeah, I guess that makes sense. Well, I grew up in a pretty small town and my parents were always really supportive of me. But even though things were generally good, I always felt like there was something missing in my life. Like there was this hole inside of me that I couldn't fill no matter what I did. So eventually, I started turning to drugs and alcohol to try and numbed the pain. And that's when things started going downhill..."
 "It sounds like you've been through a lot. And it makes sense that you would turn to drugs and alcohol to numb the pain. But it's important to try and find healthy ways to deal with your feelings. Otherwise, it can be easy to get caught in a spiral of addiction."
 "Yeah, I know. I've been trying to quit for awhile now, but it's just so hard. I feel like I'm always one step away from relapsing."
 "Recovery is a difficult process, but you're doing the right thing by seeking help. Just remember that relapse is always a possibility, but as long as you're willing to keep fighting, there's always hope for a better tomorrow."]

head: PersonX suggests seeking counseling
literal: Maksim suggests seeking counseling. Now Maksim feels compassionate.
narrative: Maksim suggested that James seek counseling. Maksim felt compassionate towards James and wanted to help him in any way possible.
dialogue:
["James, I'm worried about you. You've been acting really Strange lately."
 'What do you mean?'
 "You've been really withdrawn and you're not eating very much. You just don't seem like yourself."
 "I don't know what you're talking about. I'm fine."
 "No, you're not fine. I think you should talk to someone about what's going on with you."
 "There's nothing to talk about! I told you, I'm fine!"
 "Fine, then don't talk to me about it. But please, James, just go talk to someone who can help you figure out what's going on with you."
 "I don't need help! I'm fine!"
 "James, you're not fine. You need help. Trust me, I'm worried about you and I just want to see you get better."
 "There's nothing wrong with me! I don't need help! Just leave me alone!"
 "James, please. Just talk to someone. That's all I'm asking."
 "No! I don't need help! Leave me alone!"]

head: PersonX begins a counseling session
literal: Paxtyn begins a counseling session because Paxtyn wants to be better.
narrative: Paxtyn begins a counseling session because Paxtyn wants to be better. Paxtyn has been feeling down lately and has been struggling to cope with life. He hopes that by talking to someone, he will be able to feel better about himself and his life.
dialogue:
['Hey there. Thanks for seeing me today.'
 'No problem, Paxtyn. How are you doing?'
 "I've been better, to be honest. I'm just struggling a lot lately and feeling down about myself and my life."
 "That sounds tough. Can you tell me more about what's going on?"
 "It's just everything, you know? I feel like I'm not good enough and that things will never get better. I hate myself and sometimes I just wish I could disappear."
 "Those are really intense feelings, Paxtyn. It sounds like you're really struggling with something right now. Is there anything in particular that's been triggering these feelings for you?"
 "Well, lately my job has been really stressful and I'm not doing as well as I'd like at school. My parents are always on my case about one thing or another and it feels like nobody understands me or how hard things are for me right now."
 "It sounds like you're feeling isolated and alone right now, which can amplify all of the other negative emotions you're experiencing. Have you talked to anyone else about how you're feeling?"
 "No, not really. I don't want to burden anyone else with my problems and I'm afraid they'll think I'm weak if I can't handle things on my own."
 "It's understandable that you feel that way, but it's important to talk to someone about how you're feeling in order to get support and start working through these emotions. Would you be willing to talk about some of the specific things that are going on with me?"
 'Yeah, I guess so.'
 "Great. Let's start with your job. What's been going on there that's been causing you so much stress?"]

head: PersonX helps make peace
literal: Magaly helps make peace. Now Magaly makes peace with his father.
narrative: Magaly helps make peace with his father by talking to him about their relationship and what they both want from it. Magaly also agrees to go to counseling with his father to help improve their communication.
dialogue:
['Hey dad, I wanted to talk to you about our relationship and what we both want from it.'
 "Sure, son. What's on your mind?"
 "Well, I know we've had our differences in the past and I just wanted to try and make peace with you. I know things haven't always been easy between us but I love you and I don't want to fight with you anymore."
 "I love you too, Magaly. And I don't want to fight with you either. We're just so different sometimes it's hard to see eye-to-eye. But that doesn't mean we can't try harder to understand each other."
 "Yeah, I know that. And I'm willing to go to counseling with you if it would help improve our communication."
 "That sounds like a great idea! Let's set up an appointment with a counselor and start working on this together."
 "I'd like that. Thanks, dad."
 'No problem, son. I love you no matter what.']

head: PersonX is guilty of mis-handling
literal: Macayla is guilty of mis-handling. Now Macayla wants to be treated with respect.
narrative: Macayla is guilty of putting his hands on a female employee in an aggressive manner. He has been ordered by the court to receive counseling and anger management classes. Macayla wants to be treated with respect and without judgement from his co-workers.
dialogue:
['Hey, can I talk to you for a second?' "Sure. What's up?"
 "I just wanted to apologize for what happened the other day. I know I shouldn't have put my hands on you like that and I'm really sorry."
 "It's okay, I understand why you were upset. But you really need to learn how to control your anger. Maybe some counseling or anger management classes would help."
 "Yeah, maybe you're right. I don't want to lose my job over something like this though. Do you think people are judging me?"
 "Of course not. We're all human and we all make mistakes. Just try to stay calm in the future and things will be fine."]

head: PersonX enters counseling
literal: Lukas enters counseling. Now Lukas feels motivated.
narrative: Lukas enters counseling. His therapist helps him to see that his problems stem from a lack of self-esteem. Lukas feels motivated to work on himself after realizing this.
dialogue:
["I've been thinking a lot lately about why things haven't been going well for me."
 'What do you mean?'
 "I don't know. It just seems like no matter what I do, I can't seem to catch a break. Everything falls apart and it's always my fault. I feel like I'm just not good enough."
 'Do you really believe that?'
 "I don't know. Sometimes it feels like the only thing I'm good at is screwing up."
 'Lukas, can you tell me more about why you feel this way? Where do you think these feelings come from?'
 "It's just...I don't know. Life has always been hard, even when things were going right on the surface, there was always something wrong underneath. And now it feels like everything is falling apart and I can't fix it. I feel so helpless and alone."
 'You\'re not alone, Lukas. We\'re here to help you through this difficult time. As for feeling helpless, that\'s understandable given your situation. But remember, you are the one in control of your life and your choices. You have the power to change things if you don\'t like the way they are now."'
 "I don't know if I can. I've tried before and it never works out."
 "You're different now, Lukas. You've grown and learned from your past experiences. You can use that knowledge to make better choices in the future."
 "I guess you're right. It's just hard to see things clearly when you're in the middle of it all."
 'That\'s why we\'re here to help you. We\'ll be with you every step of the way, Lukas. Together, we\'ll get through this."']

head: PersonX begins a counseling session
literal: Brianny had a problem. Brianny begins a counseling session.
narrative: Brianny had a problem. He was struggling in school and he felt like he didn't fit in. Brianny began a counseling session and the counselor helped him to understand his feelings and work through his struggles.
dialogue:
["I don't know, I just feel like I don't fit in anywhere."
 "It sounds like you're feeling a bit lost and confused. Can you tell me more about that?"
 "Yeah, I guess. It's just, like, nothing feels right anymore. School is hard and I don't have any friends that I can really rely on. And my parents are always fighting and they don't even seem to care about me anymore."
 "That sounds really tough, Brianny. It's normal to feel like this at your age but it sounds like you're dealing with a lot more than most kids your age. Let's see if we can work through some of these issues together, okay?"
 'Yeah, okay.'
 'So, you said school is hard for you right now? Can you tell me more about that?'
 "Yeah. I just, I don't know. Everything feels so different this year and I'm just not sure how to keep up. My grades have slipped and I'm really behind in some of my classes. And even when I do understand what's going on, it's like there's this big test coming up that I know I'm going to fail no matter what."
 "Okay, well let's talk about that a little bit more then. Do you feel like you're capable of doing the work?"
 "Sometimes, yeah. But sometimes it just feels like it's all too much and I can't focus or anything."
 'That sounds very frustrating. Do you have any ideas of why it might be difficult for you to focus? Is there anything going on in your life that might be adding to that stress?'
 'Like what?'
 "Well, for example, you mentioned your parents fighting a lot at home. Do you think that might be affecting how you're doing in school?"
 "Yeah, maybe. It's just really loud and they're always arguing about something and it makes it hard to concentrate on anything else."
 "Okay, well let's try to brainstorm some ways to help with that then. Maybe we can come up with a plan for when your parents are fighting so that you can still focus on your schoolwork despite the noise level at home. What do you think about that?"
 'Yeah, okay']

head: PersonX begins a counseling session
literal: Javier begins a counseling session because Javier wants to help someone.
narrative: Javier begins a counseling session because Javier wants to help people who have anxiety. He has suffered from anxiety himself, and he knows how debilitating it can be. He hopes that by counseling others with anxiety, he can help them to overcome it and live happier lives.
dialogue:
['Hi, Sarah. How are you today?'
 "I'm okay, I guess. Just a little anxious."
 "Yeah, I understand. Anxiety can be tough to deal with. But I'm here to help you through it. Let's talk about what's been going on that's been making you feel anxious."
 "Well, I've just been really stressed out lately. My job is really demanding and I've been having a lot of trouble sleeping at night. Whenever I do fall asleep, I have these awful nightmares that wake me up again and again. And during the day, my mind just feels like it's racing all the time and it's hard to focus on anything else."
 "That sounds very difficult to deal with. It sounds like your anxiety is really taking a toll on your life right now. But we're going to work together to try to reduce your anxiety and help you get back on track. Do you think that would be okay?"
 'Yes, thank you Javier. I appreciate your help']

head: PersonX finds hope and self-esteem in counseling
literal: Crista is optimistic. Crista finds hope and self-esteem in counseling.
narrative: Crista is optimistic about her future and finds hope and self-esteem in counseling. She has been working hard in therapy to overcome her past trauma and believes that she can achieve anything she sets her mind to. Crista is an inspiration to those around her, always finding the positive in every situation.
dialogue:
["I'm feeling really optimistic about my future right now. I've been working hard in therapy to overcome my past trauma and I feel like I can achieve anything I set my mind to. It's been a long journey, but I'm finally starting to feel like myself again."
 "That's great to hear, Crista! It sounds like you've made a lot of progress. What do you think has been the most helpful for you in your journey?"
 "I think just having someone to talk to who understands what I've been through has been really helpful. Just being able to express how I'm feeling and knowing that someone is there for me has made all the difference. Counseling has definitely helped me find hope for the future and given me back some self-esteem."
 "That's great to hear! It sounds like counseling has been a really positive experience for you. What are your goals for the future?"
 'I just want to be happy and healthy. I want to continue working on myself so that I can be the best version of me. I also want to help others who have been through similar experiences. I know how hard it is to overcome trauma, but I believe that anything is possible if you set your mind to it.'
 "That's an admirable goal, Crista. I think you're going to achieve great things in your future."]

You are smart and capable, and you can do this. Remember that everyone feels lost at some point in their life, so you're not alone in how you're feeling. Just take things one step at a time and don't be too hard on yourself. You'll get through this"
 'Thank you. Just talking to you has helped me feel a little better.'
 "I'm glad I could help. If you ever need to talk, don't hesitate to reach out to me."]

head: PersonX leaves jail and has to face society

 "I'm scared that people are going to judge me."
 "People are going to judge you no matter what, Kiyana. But you can't let that stop you from living your life. You need to learn to accept yourself for who you are and move on with your life."

head: PersonX goes back to counseling
literal: Bram goes back to counseling. Now Bram feels better.
narrative: Bram went back to counseling. She felt better after being able to talk about her problems and feeling like she had someone who understood her.
dialogue:
['So, how are things going?'
 'Things are going well. How are things with you?'
 "I'm doing better. I've been going to therapy and it's helping me a lot."
 "That's great! I'm glad to hear that therapy is helping you. What kind of things have you been talking about in therapy?"
 "Mostly about my family and growing up. It's been really helpful to talk about my childhood and what it was like for me growing up."
 'That makes sense. Often times our families can be a source of a lot of pain and hurt, so it can be very healing to talk about those experiences and process them in a safe place. Have you been able to talk about anything else in therapy?'
 "Yeah, I've also been talking about my relationship with my boyfriend. We've been together for a while but we recently broke up and it's been really tough for me. Talking about it in therapy has helped me understand what happened and why it happened, which has made it easier to deal with."
 "Breakups are always difficult, no matter how long the relationship was or who initiates the break-up. It sounds like you're doing a great job processing everything though and working through your pain in a healthy way by coming to therapy and talking about it all openly."]

head: PersonX practices psychotherapy
literal: Jane practices psychotherapy. Now Jane feels interested.
narrative: Jane practices psychotherapy. She has a private practice where she sees clients for therapy sessions. She also offers counseling services to individuals, couples, and families.
dialogue:
['So, Sarah, how are you doing today?'
 "I'm doing okay, I guess. Just feeling a little down lately."
 "I'm sorry to hear that. What's been going on?"
 "Just feeling like I'm not good enough, like I'm not reaching my potential."
 'That sounds very difficult. Can you tell me more about that?'
 "It just feels like no matter what I do, it's never enough. And I don't know how to make it better."
 "Sarah, it sounds like you're really hard on yourself. Do you think that might be part of the problem?"
 "Maybe...I don't know. It just feels like I can't ever catch a break."
 "Well, let's talk about that some more and see if we can figure out what might be going on."]

head: PersonX suggests seeking counseling
literal: Hattie suggests seeking counseling. Now Hattie feels better.
narrative: Hattie felt awful and he knew he needed to seek counseling. He found a therapist that he could talk to about his problems and felt better after a few sessions.
dialogue:
["I'm really struggling right now. I don't know how to deal with everything that's going on."
 "What's going on?"
 "My dad died a few weeks ago and I can't stop thinking about it. I keep reliving the moment when I found out and it's just so hard."
 'That sounds really tough. How are you sleeping?'
 "Not well. I have a lot of nightmares about my dad dying. In the nightmares, he's always in pain and gasping for breath and there's nothing I can do to help him. It's just so awful."
 "That does sound very upsetting. Have you been talking to anyone else about how you're feeling?"
 "Yeah, I've talked to my mom and my friends but it doesn't really seem to help. They all say that time heals all wounds but I don't see how that could be possible in this case."
 "Well, it might not happen overnight but eventually, with time and healing, those intense feelings will start to fade away and you'll be able to think about your dad without feeling so overwhelmed with sadness. What are some things that make you happy? That you enjoy doing?"
 "I like playing video games and hanging out with my friends. But lately, even those things haven't been making me feel better like they used to."
 'Maybe what you need is some more time before jumping back into your hobbies full force again. Grief can be exhausting both emotionally and mentally, so it makes sense that your energy levels would be down as well. Just take things one day at a time for now and focus on taking care of yourself both physically and emotionally."'
 'Thank you. That actually makes a lot of sense. I think I need to take some time off from work and just focus on taking care of myself for a while.'
 "That sounds like a good idea. Make sure to keep communicating with your loved ones and let them know how you're feeling. It can be really helpful to talk about your dad and memories you have of him with people who understand what you're going through."]

head: PersonX hears a counselor on the radio
literal: Aaren hears a counselor on the radio. Now Aaren is encouraged to seek counseling.
narrative: Aaren hears a counselor on the radio. The counselor talks about how to deal with anger and hurt feelings. Aaren is encouraged to seek counseling.
dialogue:
["I was just listening to your show and I really resonated with what you were saying about anger and hurt feelings. I'm struggling with those a lot lately."
 "It sounds like you're going through a tough time. Can you tell me more about what's going on?"
 "Well, my wife and I have been married for 15 years and we have three kids. Recently, she told me she wants a divorce. It came out of nowhere and I'm still trying to process it all. I feel so hurt and betrayed. I thought we were happy together. Now, I don't know what to do or where to turn."
 "It sounds like you're feeling a lot of pain right now. And it's natural to feel angry when we've been hurt like this. But it's important to try to find healthy ways to deal with that anger so it doesn't take over our lives. Have you been able to talk to your wife about how you're feeling?"
 "Yeah, we've talked some. But it's hard. I don't understand why she wants to leave. She says she's not happy, but I thought we were doing ok. I just feel so lost right now."
 "It sounds like you're feeling a lot of confusion and uncertainty. That's normal when something like this happens. But it's important to try to stay focused on taking care of yourself and your children during this time. Are you doing anything for yourself to help deal with all the emotions you're feeling?"
 "Not really. I've been trying to distract myself by working more and keeping busy. But that just doesn't seem to be helping much."
 "It's important to allow yourself time to grieve the loss of your marriage and what you thought it would be. Maybe there are some things you can do that will help you feel better, even if it's just for a little while each day. Have you tried talking to friends or family about what's going on?"
 "Yeah, I've talked to my parents and my siblings some. But they're all pretty far away so it's not easy to talk with them as much as I'd like. And my friends, well, most of them are married so it's hard for them to really understand what I'm going through right now."
 "It sounds like you could use some support from people who understand what you're going through. Maybe there are groups or counseling available in your area specifically for people who are going through divorce? That might be something worth looking into."
 'Yeah, that might be helpful. Thanks for the suggestion']

head: PersonX really appreciates seeing a counselor

dialogue:
["Counselor, I really appreciate you seeing me today. I've been struggling a lot lately with anxiety and it's been really tough to manage."
 'That sounds very difficult, Brecken. Can you tell me more about what has been going on?'
 "Yeah, sure. It's just been feeling like my anxiety is out of control and I can't seem to get it under control no matter what I do. I'm constantly worrying about things and my heart races all the time. It's just really tough to deal with."
 "It sounds like you're feeling very overwhelmed by your anxiety. Have you tried any coping mechanisms or relaxation techniques?"
 "Yes, I've tried a few things but nothing seems to help. I just can't seem to calm down no matter what I do."
 "Well, let's explore some other options then. Have you ever considered medication for your anxiety?"
 "No, I haven't really considered that option. I'm not sure if I'm ready to go that route yet."
 "That's perfectly understandable. Medication isn't right for everyone. But it is something we can consider if other options don't seem to be working. Let's keep exploring different options and see what might work best for you."]

dialogue:
["I just don't know what to do. I've lost everything that was important to me."
 "It sounds like you're feeling really lost and helpless right now. Depression can be incredibly isolating and it sounds like you're feeling very alone."
 'Yeah, I am. I feel like I have no one to turn to.'
 "That's a common feeling when people are struggling with depression. But it's important to remember that you're not alone. There are people who care about you and want to help you through this tough time."
 "It's just so hard sometimes. I feel like I'm never going to get better and that things will never get back to normal."
 "It's normal to feel like that when you're going through something as tough as depression, but it's important to remember that there is hope. Things can and will get better, even if it doesn't seem like it right now."
 "I just don't know if I can do this."
 'Yes, you can. You are strong and you have been through a lot. You can get through this depression and come out the other side even stronger.']

 "That can be really tough to deal with, especially if you're already feeling isolated and alone. Maybe we can brainstorm some ideas of ways for you to connect with people and build new relationships?"]

dialogue:
['Hey, thanks for seeing me again.' 'Of course. How are you doing?'
 "I'm good. I just wanted to talk to you about something that's been on my mind."
 "What's that?"
 "My sister is going out of town for a few days and she asked me to watch her daughter. I'm not really sure if I'm ready for that kind of responsibility."
 'Why do you say that?'
 "I just don't know if I can handle it emotionally. It's a lot of pressure."
 "lane, you've been through a lot lately with your own emotional struggles. Do you think this might be a good opportunity for you to practice taking care of someone else? To see if you're really ready for it?"
 "Yeah, maybe you're right. I just don't want to screw it up."
 "You won't screw it up, Saskia. You're a good person with a lot of love to give. Just take things one step at a time and trust yourself. You'll be fine."
 'Thanks. I needed to hear that.' 'Anytime.']

head: PersonX enters counseling

dialogue:
['I really want to go back to school and get my degree.'
 "That's a great goal, Gracelyn. Let's talk about why you want to go back to school and what your plans are."
 "I dropped out of college a few years ago and I've always regretted it. I want to finish my degree so that I can get a good job and provide for my family."
 "That's admirable. What do you plan on studying?"
 "I'm not sure yet. I was thinking maybe business or something in the medical field."
 'Those are both great options. Have you taken any steps towards enrolling in school?'
 "Not yet, but I'm ready to do it now. I just need some help getting started."
 "Absolutely, we can help you with that. Let's start by looking at some schools that might be a good fit for you and then we can work on getting the application process started."]

head: PersonX enters counseling
literal: Zian is emotional. Zian enters counseling.
narrative: Zian is emotional. He has a lot of anxiety and sometimes he can't control his emotions. He's been in counseling for a while and it's helped him a lot.
dialogue:
['Hey, how are you doing today?' "I'm doing well, Zian. How are you?"
 "I'm feeling a little anxious today. I had a bad dream last night and it's been bothering me all day."
 'That sounds tough. Do you want to talk about the dream?'
 'Yeah, I guess so. In the dream, I was back in high school and I was failing all my classes. Everyone was laughing at me and making fun of me. It was really embarrassing.'
 "It sounds like the dream was triggering some anxiety around school for you. Can you tell me more about that? Are you worried about going back to school? Or maybe there's something else that's been going on that's been worrying you?"
 "Yeah, I've been really worried about going back to school. I don't know if I can handle it after what happened last year. And now with the pandemic, it's just all so uncertain. What if something happens to me or my family? What if we get sick? What if we can't pay our bills? There are just so many what-ifs swirling around in my head all the time..."
 "It sounds like you're feeling really overwhelmed right now. Let's take a few deep breaths and see if we can focus on one thing at a time. Why don't we start with your worries about school? What specifically are you worried about?"
 "I'm worried about failing again. I'm worried about not being able to keep up with the work. I'm worried about my classmates making fun of me. I'm just really afraid of going back and not being able to handle it."
 "Those are all valid concerns, Zian. But I think it's important to remember that you're not alone in this. We can work together to figure out a plan to help you succeed in school. And as for your classmates, have you talked to anyone about how they've been treating you?"
 "No, I haven't really talked to anyone about it. I guess I've just been avoiding them because I don't want to deal with it."
 "Avoiding the problem isn't going to make it go away, Zian. It might be helpful to talk to someone who can help you address the situation with your classmates head-on. Would you be open to that?"
 "Yeah, I guess so...I just don't know what to say or how to fix it though."
 "That's something we can work on together, Zian. Let's brainstorm some possible solutions and see if we can come up with a plan that will work for you"]

 "I'm not really sure. I just feel really lost and alone."

 'That sounds like a lot to deal with. Have you ever talked to anyone about your feelings?'
 "No, not really. I guess I've just been too scared or ashamed to talk to anyone about it."
 "It's okay to feel that way, but it's important to talk to someone who can help you sort through everything that's going on. We have counselors here at the clinic who can help you with that if you're interested."
 'Yeah, I think that would be helpful. Thank you for your help today.']

head: PersonX finds hope and self-esteem in counseling

 'Of course. How are you feeling today?'
 "I'm feeling pretty good, actually. I feel like I'm making progress."
 "That's great to hear! I think you should be really proud of yourself."
 'Yeah, I feel like I am finally starting to understand myself more and what motivates me.'
 "That's excellent news! Understanding yourself is such an important part of confidence and self-esteem. How do you think counseling has been helping you so far?"
 "Well, just talking to someone who understands and can help me see things from a different perspective has been really helpful. Plus, it feels good to know that there's someone out there who cares about my well-being and wants to help me improve my life."
 "We care about all of our clients here and want to see them succeed in life. So I'm glad to hear that you're finding counseling helpful and that you feel supported by us. Do you think you'll continue coming for counseling?"
 'Yeah, I think so. I feel like I still have a lot to learn about myself and I want to become even more confident.'
 "That's a great attitude! I think you'll continue to make progress if you keep coming to counseling and working on yourself."]

 'I was thinking maybe we should go to counseling.'

 "Yeah, I think it would help us a lot. We've been having some trouble lately and I really want to work on our relationship."
 "Okay, I'm willing to try anything. Let's go to counseling and see if it helps."]

head: PersonX is given counseling
