 "I don't know, it's just everything really. I feel like I'm not good enough at my job, my relationships are falling apart, and I just don't feel like I'm worth very much as a person."
 'That sounds really tough to deal with all of those things at once. It sounds like your self-esteem has taken a hit recently. Do you want to talk more about that? We can explore how to build your self-esteem back up and also work on improving your relationships']

head: PersonX begins a counseling session
tail: to be able to help others
literal: Queenie begins a counseling session because Queenie wants to be able to help others.
narrative: Queenie begins a counseling session. Queenie wants to help others by sharing his story and experiences. Queenie wants to be able to connect with others and help them understand their own stories.
dialogue:
['Hey, thanks for meeting with me today.'
 'No problem, what would you like to talk about?'
 'Well, I guess I just wanted to share my story and experiences with you. I hope that by doing so, it will help others understand their own stories better.'
 'That sounds great, Queenie. Please go ahead.'
 'Well, growing up, I always felt different from everyone else. I never really fit in anywhere, and it was always hard for me to make friends. As a result, I became pretty introverted and withdrawn. When I was sixteen, things got really bad for me and I attempted suicide. Thankfully, I failed and woke up in the hospital the next day surrounded by my family who all told me how much they loved me. After that experience, I realized that life is precious and worth living no matter how hard things get. So I made a decision to turn my life around and started working on myself. It\'s been a long journey but slowly but surely things have gotten better for me over the years. And now here I am today working as a counselor myself so that hopefully I can help others who are going through similar experiences."'
 'Wow Queenie, thank you so much for sharing your story with me. It sounds like you\'ve been through a lot but you\'ve also overcome a lot too which is really inspiring."'
 'Yeah thanks...It hasn\'t been easy but it\'s definitely worth it when you see yourself making progress."'
 'Absolutely! So do you think sharing your story has helped you connect with others more?'
 'Yeah definitely...I feel like understanding my own story has helped me be more compassionate towards others and also more patient because sometimes people need time to open up about their own experiences."']

head: PersonX saves his marriage
literal: Aurelius saves his marriage. Now Aurelius is happy.
narrative: Aurelius was having a lot of trouble in his marriage and he was really unhappy. He decided to go to counseling and it saved his marriage. Now Aurelius is happy and he and his wife are doing great.
dialogue:
["Hi, I'm Aurelius." 'Hi Aurelius, how are you doing today?'
 "Not too good. My marriage is really struggling and I'm just really unhappy."
 "I'm sorry to hear that. What's been going on?"
 "Well, we just don't seem to be able to communicate anymore. We're always arguing and it just feels like we're growing apart."
 "That sounds very difficult. Have you tried talking to your wife about how you're feeling?"
 'Yeah, but it just ends up in a big argument. Nothing ever gets resolved.'
 "It sounds like you're both feeling pretty frustrated then. Can you tell me more about the arguments you've been having? Are there any particular topics that seem to be causing the most problems?"
 "Well, lately it seems like everything is a problem. We can't even agree on what TV show to watch anymore! But I think the biggest issue is that she feels like I'm not giving her enough attention. She says I'm always working or studying and she feels like she's second in my life."
 'That definitely sounds like a problem area that could use some improvement. How do you feel when she brings up this issue?'
 "defensive and guilty, mostly because deep down I know she's right...I have been neglecting her lately with school and work being so busy. But it's hard because I feel like I can't do anything right! If I stay home with her then I feel guilty about school and if go out then she gets mad because she thinks I'm choosing work over her..."
 'It sounds like there is a lot of tension between the two of you right now which is completely understandable given the circumstances. What would you say is your biggest goal for coming here today?'
 "Just to figure out how to make things better between us...I love my wife and I don't want our marriage to end but right now it feels like we're heading in that direction.."]

head: PersonX finds hope and self-esteem in counseling
literal: Skyler finds hope and self-esteem in counseling because Skyler wants to be happy.
narrative: Skyler has been through a lot in her life and she wants to be happy. She finds hope and self-esteem in counseling because it helps her understand herself and her situation better. It also makes her feel good to know that someone is there for her, listening to her and trying to help her.
dialogue:
["I'm really struggling right now. I feel like I'm not good enough and that things will never get better."
 "I'm so sorry to hear that, Skyler. It sounds like you're feeling really down about yourself. Can you tell me more about why you feel this way?"
 "It's just everything. My family, my job, my life. I don't know, it all just feels so hopeless sometimes."
 "Yes, it can be tough when we feel like we're stuck in a rut. But it sounds like you have some specific things that are causing you stress or making you feel bad about yourself. Do you want to talk about those?"
 "Yeah, I guess so. My family is really important to me, but they can be really critical sometimes. They always seem to find something to criticize me about, no matter what I do or how hard I try. And it's just exhausting trying to please them all the time."
 "That definitely sounds difficult and frustrating. It's normal to want our families to be proud of us and support us, but it sounds like that isn't always the case for you. Do you have any other close relationships that are supportive? Or anything else that makes you feel good about yourself?"
 'Yeah, I have some friends who are really great and accepting of me no matter what. And counseling has actually been really helpful for me too. Just talking through my thoughts and feelings with someone who understands has been really valuable for me.'
 "That's great to hear! It sounds like you've found some things that help counteract the negative messages you might get from your family members then?"
 'Yeah, definitely. Just knowing that there are people in my life who love and accept me for who I am makes a big difference']

head: PersonX enters counseling
literal: Addalynn enters counseling. Now Addalynn wants to talk about his problems.
narrative: Addalynn enters counseling. He wants to talk about his problems with depression and anxiety. He has been feeling down for a while and has trouble sleeping at night.
dialogue:
['Hi, thanks for seeing me.'
 'Of course, what would you like to talk about today?'
 "I've been feeling really down lately. I can't sleep at night and I'm just really anxious all the time."
 "That sounds tough. Can you tell me more about why you're feeling this way?"
 "Well, I just feel like everything is out of my control and it's really stressing me out. My job is really demanding and I'm just not sure how much longer I can keep doing it."
 "It sounds like you're feeling overwhelmed and hopeless. That's a tough place to be. But it sounds like you're still hanging in there, which is good. Let's talk about some ways that we can help ease your anxiety and help you get through this tough time."
 'Yeah, that would be great.'
 'Well, one thing we can do is talk about your job and see if there are any ways that we can make it more manageable for you. Are there any specific things that are really stressing you out?'
 "Just the whole process. I'm constantly getting new assignments and I never have enough time to finish them. And my boss is always on my case about meeting deadlines."
 "That does sound pretty stressful. Let's brainstorm some possible solutions to that problem. Maybe we can come up with a plan to help you get your work done more efficiently or give you more time to complete your assignments."
 'Yeah, that would be helpful.' "Great, let's start with that then."]

head: PersonX enters counseling
literal: Corey is intelligent. Corey enters counseling.
narrative: Corey is intelligent. Corey enters counseling because he has been feeling down and wants to talk to someone about his problems. He has been having trouble at work and feels like he is not being appreciated.
dialogue:
["Hello, counselor. Thank you for seeing me today. I've been feeling really down lately and I need to talk to someone about my problems."
 "Of course, Corey. What's been going on?"
 "Well, I've been having a lot of trouble at work. I feel like I'm not being appreciated and my boss is always nitpicking everything I do. It's just really getting to me."
 "I see. That sounds like a difficult situation to be in. Can you tell me more about how you're feeling?"
 "Sure. Like I said, I just feel really down all the time. It feels like everything is going wrong and no one understands me. I know it sounds silly, but sometimes I just feel like giving up altogether. It's just so frustrating!"
 "Yes, I can imagine that it would be. It sounds like you feel like you're not in control of your life and that can be very scary."
 "Exactly! That's exactly how I feel. Like I'm just drifting along and things are happening to me, but I'm not really doing anything to make them happen. It's just all so overwhelming."
 "Corey, it sounds like you're feeling really hopeless right now. But I want you to know that there is hope. Things can get better and you can take control of your life again. We'll work together to figure out how to make that happen, okay?"
 'Okay, counselor. Thank you for talking with me today.']

head: PersonX agrees to seeing a counselor
literal: Zaki agrees to seeing a counselor. Now Zaki is helped by the counselor.
narrative: Zaki decides to go to counseling after her friends tell her it might help. Zaki is nervous but goes anyway. The counselor helps Zaki feel better and talk about her problems.
dialogue:
["I'm really nervous about this. I've never done anything like this before."
 "That's perfectly normal. Many people feel nervous or apprehensive when they come to counseling for the first time. Can you tell me what brings you here today?"
 "Well, my friends suggested that it might help me to talk to someone about some of the stuff that's been going on in my life. I've just been feeling really down lately and I don't know how to make myself feel better."
 "I see. Well, counseling can definitely be helpful in situations like this. It can provide a space for you to talk about whatever is going on in your life and explore ways to cope with your feelings. Would you like to talk about what's been going on?"
 "Yeah, I guess so. It's just been really hard lately. My mom died a few months ago and I'm still trying to deal with that. I know it's going to take time, but I can't seem to stop feeling sad all the time. And on top of that, my boyfriend broke up with me last week."
 "I'm sorry to hear that. It sounds like you've been through a lot lately. It's perfectly normal to feel overwhelmed and Sad after experiencing losses like these. How have you been coping with your sadness?"
 "Not very well, to be honest. I've been drinking a lot and not taking care of myself at all. I know I need to make some changes, but I don't know how to start or what to do."
 "Well, let's start by taking things one day at a time. What are some things you can do today to take care of yourself?"
 'I guess I could start by eating breakfast and getting out of bed for starters']

head: PersonX discovers PersonY has suffered a nervous breakdown
literal: Anylah discovers Johanna has suffered a nervous breakdown. Now Anylah wants to help Johanna.
narrative: Anylah finds Johanna crying in the bathroom. Johanna has been diagnosed with a mental illness and has been prescribed medication. Anylah wants to help Johanna get better by helping her take her medication and getting her counseling.
dialogue:
['Hey, Johanna. I saw that you were crying in the bathroom. Are you okay?'
 "No, I'm not okay. I was just diagnosed with a mental illness and prescribed medication. I don't know how to deal with this."
 "It's okay, Johanna. I'm here for you. I'll help you take your medication and get counseling if you need it. Let's talk about this together, okay?"
 "Okay…I just feel so lost right now. I don't know what to do or where to turn."
 "Well, first things first, let's make sure you're taking your medication regularly. Have you been doing that?"
 "Yeah, I've been taking it every day like the doctor said. But I don't know if it's helping or not."
 'That\'s understandable. It can take a little while for the medication to start working properly. In the meantime, let\'s focus on getting you some counseling too so that we can talk about how you\'re feeling and help you manage your illness better overall."']

head: PersonX goes back to counseling
literal: Niara goes back to counseling because Niara wants to improve her life.
narrative: Niara wants to improve her life, so she goes back to counseling. She hopes that counseling will help her feel better about herself and her life.
dialogue:
["I'm really struggling right now and I was hoping counseling could help me out."
 'What seems to be the problem?'
 "I just feel like my life is a mess. I don't know who I am or what I want to do with my life. I feel like I'm just drifting along and not really going anywhere."
 "It sounds like you're feeling lost and uncertain of yourself. Do you have any idea what might have caused you to feel this way?"
 "To be honest, I don't really know. Everything just feels so overwhelming and confusing right now. I just wish things were simpler and that I knew what to do with my life."
 "It sounds like you're feeling overwhelmed by everything in your life right now. That can be very tough to deal with, but it's important to remember that everyone feels like this at some point in their lives. The important thing is to figure out how to deal with those feelings and move forward in your life."
 "I'm just not sure how to do that. I feel like I've tried everything and nothing seems to work."
 "Well, let's talk about some of the things you've tried and see if we can figure out why they haven't worked for you. Maybe together we can come up with a plan that will help you start feeling better about yourself and your life."]

head: PersonX suggests seeking counseling
literal: Lavelle thought about it. Lavelle suggests seeking counseling.
narrative: Lavelle wants to get counseling for his relationship problems. He and his partner have been arguing a lot lately, and he thinks it would be helpful to talk to someone about it.
dialogue:
['Hi, thanks for seeing me.' 'Of course, what can I help you with?'
 'Well, my partner and I have been arguing a lot lately and I was hoping to talk to someone about it.'
 'That sounds difficult. Can you tell me more about the arguments?'
 "We just seem to disagree on everything lately. It's like we're not even on the same page anymore. And it's really starting to take a toll on our relationship."
 "That does sound tough. Have you tried communicating with your partner about how you're feeling?"
 "Yeah, we've talked about it some, but it doesn't seem to be helping. Everything just ends up in another argument. I'm just not sure what to do anymore."
 "Well, let's see if we can figure out some strategies for communicating better with each other. It sounds like you're both pretty upset and that's understandable given the situation. But if you can learn to communicate more effectively, it might help reduce the amount of arguing and help improve your relationship overall."
 "Yeah, that would be great. I'm just really not sure where to start."
 "Well, why don't we start by taking a look at how you're communicating with each other currently. What do you tend to do when you're arguing?"
 "I usually just try to get my point across and make sure that my partner understands where I'm coming from. But it seems like they're not really listening to me. And then they'll start getting defensive and we'll just end up going in circles."
 "It sounds like you're both trying to be heard but not necessarily listening to each other. That can definitely contribute to arguments escalating. One thing you might try doing is taking turns talking and really listening to what the other person is saying without interrupting them or trying to rebut their points. Just let them know that you're hearing them and then offer your own perspective after they're done speaking."
 'That makes sense. I think we both tend to jump in and try to talk over each other sometimes instead of really listening.'
 "Yes, that's a common problem. Another thing you might want to try is setting aside some time specifically for discussing things that are important to you or that are causing conflict. Make sure it's a time when neither of you are tired or stressed out from work or anything else so that you can focus on the conversation and really hear each other out."
 'Alright, that sounds like something we can definitely try doing differently.'
 "Great! Those are just a few suggestions off the top of my head. Communication is often something that couples need to work on continually throughout their relationship so don't get discouraged if it doesn't improve immediately or if arguments still happen occasionally. Just keep working at it and see how things go over time."]

head: PersonX consults a counselor
tail: to be in control of his life
literal: Maegan consults a counselor because Maegan wants to be in control of his life.
narrative: Maegan was having trouble in school and decided to consult a counselor. The counselor helped Maegan to see that he needed to be more in control of his life and set some goals. Maegan left the counseling sessions feeling empowered and ready to take on his challenges.
dialogue:
["I'm just not sure what to do. I feel like I'm struggling and I don't know how to fix it."
 "Well, let's talk about what's going on. What do you feel like is the problem?"
 "I don't know. It's just school. Everything feels so hard and I can't keep up."
 "Do you feel like you're trying your best?"
 "Yeah, but it's never enough. No matter how hard I try, I feel like I'm always behind. And now my grades are starting to slip and I'm really worried about what that means for my future."
 'Maegan, it sounds like you\'re feeling really overwhelmed right now. That\'s completely understandable given everything you\'re dealing with. But it\'s important to remember that you can\'t give up. You have to keep fighting even when things seem impossible. Because giving up is only going to make things worse in the long run. So, what can we do to help you get back on track? Let\'s start by setting some goals together, something small that you can focus on and achieve step by step."'
 "It sounds like you're saying that I need to be more in control of my life and set some goals. Is that right?"
 "Yes, that's definitely one way to look at it. It can be helpful to think about what you want to achieve and then break down the steps you need to take to get there. That way, you'll have a plan and a sense of direction, which can make things feel less overwhelming."
 "I'm not sure where to start. Everything feels so out of control right now."
 "Why don't we start with something small? What's something you'd like to accomplish in the next week or month?"
 "Well, I guess I'd like to get my grades up. That's been worrying me a lot lately."
 "Okay, so let's focus on that then. What do you think you need to do in order to raise your grades?"
 "I need to study more and I should probably talk to my teachers about what I'm struggling with. But it feels like there's so much catching up to do, I don't know if I can really do it all by myself..."
 'You\'re right, raising your grades is going to take some effort and dedication. But remember, you don\'t have to do it all by yourself. We\'re here to help you every step of the way. So let\'s make a plan together. For the next week, why don\'t we focus on studying for two hours each day? And we\'ll check in next week and see how things are going."']

head: PersonX really deserves to be forgiven
literal: Stockton really deserves to be forgiven. Now Stockton feels pleased.
narrative: Stockton was caught cheating on his girlfriend when she found explicit text messages on his phone from another woman. He has been apologetic and trying to make things right with her ever since, including going to couples counseling and vowing to never cheat again.
dialogue:
["Hey, I'm sorry about what happened. I know it was really hurtful and I've been trying to make things right with you."
 "It's been really tough. I mean, I trusted you and then you just completely betrayed me. It feels like everything between us is just a lie now."
 'I know. And I am so sorry. Believe me, it was never my intention to hurt you. I was just caught up in the moment and made a huge mistake.'
 "But how can I ever trust you again? How do I know that this won't happen again?"
 "Well, we've been going to counseling and working on our communication, and I have vowed to never cheat again. Plus, I love you more than anything in the world and would never want to lose you."
 "I love you too. But it's just going to take some time for me to heal from this and fully trust you again."
 "I understand. And I'm patient. I'll do whatever it takes to earn your trust back."]

head: PersonX goes back to counseling
literal: Demetri goes back to counseling. Now Demetri wants to get a better job.
narrative: Demetri goes back to counseling. She talks to her counselor about how she wants to get a better job. Her counselor helps her make a plan to look for a new job.
dialogue:
["Hey, I've been thinking a lot lately about my career and where I want to be. I'm not really happy with my current job and I feel like I'm stuck in a rut."
 "That sounds tough. It can be really hard feeling like you're not where you want to be in your career. What are some specific things that you don't like about your job?"
 "Well, for one, the pay is pretty low. And there's no room for growth or advancement. Plus, I just don't find the work all that fulfilling. It doesn't make me feel good at the end of the day."
 "Yeah, it sounds like this job isn't really giving you what you need right now. So it makes sense that you're wanting to look for something else."
 "Exactly. But then again, it's kind of scary looking for a new job and not knowing if I'll actually find anything better out there. Do you think I'm making the right decision?"
 "Only you can answer that question, Demetri. But from what you've said, it sounds like this isn't the right fit for you and that it might be time to move on to something new. If you're open to exploring other options, then I think it's definitely worth taking some steps towards finding a new job that will be a better fit for you."
 "Yeah, I guess you're right. It's just... scary not knowing what the future holds sometimes. But I'm willing to give it a shot if it means finding something that makes me happier in the long run. Thanks for talking with me about this today counselor"
 "You're welcome, Demetri. I'm here to support you in whatever decision you make. If you'd like, we can talk more about this next time and brainstorm some specific steps you can take to start your job search. Sound good?"
 'Yeah, that sounds good. Thanks again.']

head: PersonX is given counseling
literal: Kyliee is given counseling. Now Kyliee feels sad.
narrative: Kyliee was given counseling after she expressed feelings of sadness. The counselor helped Kyliee to understand her emotions and provided her with tools to cope with her sadness. Kyliee felt better after the counseling session and was able to continue on with her day.
dialogue:
["I just feel really sad all the time. I don't know why."
 'It sounds like you are going through a tough time. Do you want to talk about what is making you sad?'
 "I guess I just don't feel like I fit in anywhere. My friends all seem to have their own things going on and I just feel left out."
 "That can be really tough to feel like you're not part of a group. Can you tell me more about that? How does it make you feel when you're around your friends and they're talking about something that you're not a part of?"
 "I just feel really left out and alone. Like there's something wrong with me because I'm not included in what they're doing."
 "That doesn't sound like fun at all. It sounds like it's really hard for you to see your friends enjoying themselves without you being a part of it. Is there anything that you can do to try and change how you're feeling? Maybe reach out to one of your friends and see if they want to hang out separately from the group sometime?"
 "Yeah, that might help. I'll try that next time they're all hanging out without me. Thanks for the advice."]

head: PersonX finds hope and self-esteem in counseling
literal: Shanika finds hope and self-esteem in counseling because Shanika wants to be better.
narrative: Shanika has been attending counseling sessions for the past few months and has found them to be very helpful. She feels more hopeful and has a higher self-esteem than she did before. Shanika wants to continue attending counseling so that she can keep improving herself.
dialogue:
["Hi, counselor. I'm glad to see you again."
 'Hi, Shanika. How are you doing today?'
 "I'm doing well, thanks. I've been attending counseling sessions for the past few months and they've been really helpful. I feel more hopeful and my self-esteem is higher than it was before. I want to continue attending counseling so that I can keep improving myself."
 "That's great to hear, Shanika! It sounds like you're really making progress. What has been the most helpful part of counseling for you?"
 "Just being able to talk openly and honestly about everything that's going on in my life and how I'm feeling has been really helpful. It's nice to have someone who will just listen without judging me or trying to fix everything."
 "Yes, that is one of the most important parts of counseling – creating a safe space for you to express yourself freely without judgment or criticism. It sounds like you're really taking advantage of that opportunity and using it to your benefit. Keep up the good work!"]

head: PersonX refuses to go for counseling
literal: Thaddeus refuses to go for counseling because Thaddeus wants to be independent.
narrative: Thaddeus refuses to go for counseling because Thaddeus doesn't want to be dependent on anyone.
dialogue:
["I don't need to go to counseling. I can handle my own problems."
 "But you're not handling your problems. You're just ignoring them and hoping they'll go away."
 "That's not true. I'm dealing with them the best way I know how."
 "And what way is that? By drinking every night and getting angry all the time? That's not dealing with your problems, Thaddeus. That's just masking them."
 "I don't need counseling. I don't need anyone's help."
 'Why are you so afraid of getting help, Thaddeus?'
 "I'm not afraid. I just don't need it."
 "Yes, you are afraid. You're afraid of being vulnerable and admitting that you can't do this on your own."
 "That's not true!"
 "It is true, Thaddeus. And it's okay to be afraid. But you need to face your fears and get help. Otherwise, your problems are just going to keep getting worse."]

head: PersonX runs into PersonY's place
literal: Harleen runs into Daylin's place. Now Harleen learns about Daylin's job.
narrative: Daylin's job is to help people with their problems. She works at a counseling center. Harleen runs into Daylin's place and learns about her job.
dialogue:
["Hi Daylin! I saw your sign as I was walking by and thought I'd come in. What do you do here?"
 "Hi Harleen! I'm a counselor, so I help people with their problems."
 'That sounds really interesting. Do you like it?'
 "Yeah, I love it. It's very fulfilling to be able to help people work through their issues."
 'So what kind of problems do people come to you with?'
 "Oh, all sorts of things. Relationship problems, family problems, job problems, money problems...you name it, I've probably heard it before."
 'That does sound like a lot of responsibility. How do you deal with all that?'
 'Well, first of all, I\'m not alone here. We have a team of counselors who all pitch in to help our clients. And secondly, we really focus on the positives and try to help our clients see the good in their lives, even when things are tough."']

head: PersonX feels in need of help
literal: Sean feels in need of help. Now Sean seeks counseling.
narrative: Sean feels in need of help. Sean has been feeling down and out lately and has decided to seek counseling. Sean makes an appointment with a therapist and goes in for their first session.
dialogue:
["I don't know where to start."
 "That's okay. Why don't you tell me a little bit about why you're here?"
 "I just feel like I'm not doing well lately. I'm not sure what's wrong with me, but I just feel really down and out."
 "Have there been any specific things that have been bothering you or that you feel might be contributing to how you're feeling?"
 "Well, my job has been really stressful lately and I've been having a lot of arguments with my friends and family. I just feel like I can't catch a break."
 "It sounds like you've been under a lot of stress and that can definitely contribute to feeling down and out. What have you been doing to try to cope with the stress?"
 "Not much. I've tried meditation and deep breathing, but it doesn't seem to help much. I just can't seem to clear my head or relax."
 "It sounds like you haven't found anything that really works for you in terms of stress relief. Have you considered trying other things like yoga or exercise?"
 "I don't know. I'm just not sure if anything will really help. I feel like I'm just doomed to feel like this forever."
 "It's understandable to feel like that when you're going through a tough time, but it's important to remember that things can and do get better. Just because you're feeling down now doesn't mean that you always will. With time and effort, things can improve."
 'I hope so. I just feel so lost right now.'
 "It sounds like you feel like you're in uncharted territory and that can be very scary and overwhelming. But part of the therapist's job is to help guide you through difficult times and help you find your way back to a place of peace and calm. We'll work together to figure out what's been causing your distress and come up with a plan to address it so that you can start feeling better again."]

head: PersonX talks to PersonY about their marriage
tail: is glad to have PersonY back
literal: Javion talks to Coral about their marriage. Now Javion is glad to have Coral back.
narrative: Javion talks to Coral about their marriage. She is glad to have him back and wants to work on their relationship. She suggests going to counseling and he agrees.
dialogue:
["Coral, I'm really glad you're home. I know things have been tough between us lately, and I want to try to work on our relationship."
 "Yeah, me too. I don't want to lose you, Javion. You're the best thing that's ever happened to me."
 "Then let's go to counseling. It might help us figure out what we need to do to make our marriage work."
 "Alright, I'm willing to try anything if it means saving our marriage."
 "Great. I'll make an appointment with our counselor tomorrow."
 'Sounds good. I love you, Javion.' 'I love you too, Coral.']

head: PersonX offers a service
literal: Eshaal offers a service because Eshaal wants to be useful.
narrative: Eshaal offers a counseling service to help people work through their emotional problems. Eshaal has years of experience as a counselor and is passionate about helping others improve their mental wellbeing. Eshaal offers this service because they want to make a difference in the lives of others.
dialogue:
['Hi, how are you doing today?'
 "I'm feeling really down. I don't know if I can keep going."
 "That sounds very difficult. Can you tell me more about what's going on?"
 "It's just that everything seems so hopeless. I don't know if there's any point in trying anymore."
 "It sounds like you feel like you're in a very dark place right now. But it's important to remember that even in the darkest of times, there is still hope. Things can and will get better. Just hold on to that thought, okay?"
 "Yeah, I guess you're right. Thanks for listening."]

head: PersonX bites the bullet
tail: to face the consequences of his actions
literal: Maryan bites the bullet because Maryan wants to face the consequences of his actions.
narrative: Maryan is a young man who made some poor choices and is now facing the consequences. He has been given the option to avoid punishment by going to counseling, but he knows that he needs to face the consequences of his actions. He decides to bite the bullet and accept whatever punishment is coming his way.
dialogue:
["I know I've made some bad choices and I'm ready to face the consequences."
 'What led you to make these choices?'
 'I was hanging out with the wrong crowd and got caught up in some illegal activity.'
 'What illegal activity were you involved in?' 'I was dealing drugs.'
 'Why did you get involved in drug dealing?'
 'At first, it was just for the money. But then I started using drugs myself and got addicted. Dealing drugs was the only way I could get my hands on them.'
 'How do you feel about your choices now?'
 'Yes, I regret them deeply. I ruined my life and wasted so much time. If I could go back, I would never have gotten involved in drugs at all.'
 'What are you willing to do to change your life now?'
 "I'm willing to do whatever it takes. I know I need help and I'm ready to get clean and turn my life around."]

head: PersonX holds a rally
literal: Jenaya holds a rally because Jenaya wants to help his community.
narrative: Jenaya held a rally to help his community by informing them of the dangers of drug use. He also set up a booth where people could sign up for drug counseling and treatment.
dialogue:
["Hey, Sarah. I'm really glad you came out to my rally today."
 'Yeah, no problem. I wanted to support you and your cause.'
 'Thanks. It means a lot to me. So many people in our community are struggling with drug addiction, and I just want to help however I can.'
 "I know it's a big problem. My cousin is addicted to heroin, and it's been really hard on our family."
 "Yeah, I can imagine. It's hard to watch someone you love suffer and not be able to do anything about it."
 "Yeah. And it's not just the person who's addicted, it's everyone around them too."
 "Exactly. That's why I'm trying to raise awareness and get people into treatment. It's not going to be easy, but I'm hopeful that we can make a difference."
 "I admire your dedication, Jenaya. You're really doing something special here."]

head: PersonX read PersonY's file
literal: Chole read Kamyah's file. Now Chole wants to talk to Kamyah.
narrative: Chole read Kamyah's file. Chole wanted to know why Kamyah had been referred to the counseling center. Chole thought that maybe she could help Kamyah if she knew more about her situation.
dialogue:
["Hi Kamyah. I'm Chole and I'll be your counselor today." 'Hi.'
 "So, Kamyah, can you tell me why you're here today?"
 "Uh, well, my friends have been telling me that I've been acting really weird lately and they're worried about me. And I don't know, I just feel like something's wrong but I don't know what it is."
 "Okay. That sounds like a pretty big concern for your friends to have. Do you mind if we talk about what's been going on that's been worrying them?"
 'Yeah, sure. I guess so. It\'s just, everything feels really off to me lately and like, nothing is going right and even things that used to make me happy don\'t seem to make me happy anymore. It\'s like there\'s this big hole inside of me and no matter what I do, I can\'t seem to fill it up or make it go away. And it\'s scary because sometimes I just feel like giving up entirely and disappearing into that hole forever. But then other times I\'ll get these brief moments of hope where things feel normal again and like maybe there\'s still a chance for things to get better... but then it all goes back to feeling wrong again shortly after."'
 "Well Kamyah, it sounds like you've been through a lot recently and are feeling very overwhelmed. It's normal to feel like this after experiencing some major life changes or stressors but it sounds like the way you're feeling is impacting your day-to-day life quite a bit which is why your friends are so worried about you. Would you say that you've been having more trouble functioning at work or school? Or maybe withdrawing from activities or hobbies that you used to enjoy?"
 'Yeah...I guess so? Everything just feels really hard lately and nothing seems worth doing anymore because whatever happens, eventually things will just go back to feeling wrong again anyway."'
 'Yes, it sounds like the negative thoughts and feelings are really affecting your quality of life right now which is why seeking counseling can be such a helpful step in managing them better."'
 'Yeah...I guess I just don\'t really know what to do anymore or how to make things better. I feel like I\'ve tried everything and nothing works."'
 "Well, let's talk about some of the things you've tried and see if there might be some other options that we can explore together. Has anything helped at all in managing the way you're feeling? Even a little bit?"]

head: PersonX avoids seeing a counselor
tail: to avoid talking about his problems
literal: Simeon avoids seeing a counselor because Simeon wants to avoid talking about his problems.
narrative: Simeon avoids seeing a counselor because she is afraid of discussing her problems. She does not want to face her fears, and she would rather stay in her comfort zone. However, avoiding counseling means that Simeon is not working on resolving her issues.
dialogue:
['Hi.' 'Hi, Simeon. How are you doing today?'
 "I'm okay. Just a little nervous, I guess."
 "That's perfectly normal. Why don't we start by talking about what brought you here today?"
 "Well, I've been having some problems lately and I'm not really sure how to deal with them. Everything just seems so overwhelming and I don't know where to start."
 "That sounds very difficult. Let's see if we can break it down into smaller pieces and figure out a plan together. Can you tell me more about what has been going on?"
 "It's just been really hard lately. I've been feeling down and depressed and I don't know why. Everything feels like such a struggle and I can't seem to make myself happy."
 "You sound like you're going through a tough time. Depression can be very overwhelming, but there are ways to manage it and get help. Let's talk about some of the things that have been going on that have been making you feel this way. Has anything changed in your life recently?"
 "Yeah, I guess you could say that. My mom died a few months ago and it's been really hard for me to deal with."
 "That's understandable. Losing a loved one is always difficult, but it sounds like you might be having a particularly hard time with it. Can you tell me more about how you're feeling?"
 "I just feel so lost without her. She was always the one who helped me through everything and now I don't know what to do without her. I miss her so much and it hurts so much knowing that she's gone forever."
 'That sounds incredibly painful and difficult to cope with. Grief is a process that takes time, but there are things we can do to help make it more manageable. Would you like to talk about some of those things?']

head: PersonX stops her habit
literal: Briyanna stops her habit because Briyanna wants to stop smoking.
narrative: Briyanna has smoked since she was 16, but now that she's pregnant, she's determined to quit. She's tried to quit before, but always went back to smoking eventually. This time, she's using a nicotine patch and going to counseling to help her quit for good.
dialogue:
["I've been smoking since I was 16, and now that I'm pregnant, I'm determined to quit. I've tried to quit before, but always went back to smoking eventually. This time, I'm using a nicotine patch and going to counseling to help me quit for good."
 "Briyanna, congratulations on your pregnancy! That's a great motivation to quitting smoking. Can you tell me a little bit about why you think you've gone back to smoking in the past?"
 "Yeah, I think it's just been really hard to break the habit. I smoke when I'm stressed out or bored, and it's just become such a part of my daily routine. But I really don't want my child to grow up seeing me smoke, so I'm determined to make this work."
 "That makes a lot of sense. It can be really tough to break old habits, especially when they're associated with certain emotions or activities. What do you think will be the hardest part about quitting this time around?"
 "Honestly, just staying away from cigarettes in general. Once I start smoking again, it's hard for me to stop. So avoiding situations where I would normally smoke is going to be key for me."
 "Absolutely! Staying away from triggers is a big part of quitting successfully. Are there any other factors you're taking into consideration while trying to quit this time?"
 "Yeah, like I said before, I'm using a nicotine patch and going to counseling.I feel like having that support will make all the difference for me this time around."
 "Absolutely! Support is essential when trying to make any kind of lifestyle change. We'll be here rooting for you every step of the way!"]

head: PersonX goes back to counseling
literal: Daren goes back to counseling because Daren wants to feel better.
narrative: Daren goes back to counseling because she feels like she's been struggling more lately and wants to get some help. She's been feeling really down and anxious, and she's been having a lot of intrusive thoughts that are making her feel even worse. She hopes that counseling will help her feel better and get rid of some of the negative thoughts that have been plaguing her.
dialogue:
['Hi, thank you for seeing me today.'
 'Hi Daren, of course. How are you doing?'
 "I've been better. I'm feeling really down and anxious lately, and I've been having a lot of intrusive thoughts that are making me feel even worse."
 "That sounds tough. Can you tell me more about the intrusive thoughts you're having?"
 "They're just really negative thoughts about myself that keep popping into my head and won't go away. It's like no matter what I do, I can't get rid of them. And they're just making me feel so much worse."
 'Do you have any idea why you might be having these thoughts?'
 "I don't know. Maybe because things have been going really badly for me lately? Everything just seems to be falling apart and I feel like I can't do anything right."
 "Yeah, it sounds like things have been pretty tough for you recently. But it's important to remember that these thoughts are just your thoughts- they don't necessarily reflect reality or how others see you. Just because you're thinking them doesn't mean they're true."
 'But it feels like they are true...I guess I just believe them because they keep coming into my head all the time.'
 "That makes sense, but try to remind yourself that they aren't necessarily accurate- especially if they're making you feel bad about yourself. Thoughts are often influenced by our emotions, so when we're feeling down, our thoughts tend to be more negative as well. But that doesn't mean those negative thoughts are true- it's just a reflection of how we're feeling in the moment."
 "Yeah...I guess that makes sense. It's just hard to believe that when I'm feeling so bad all the time..."
 'Yes, it can be hard to change the way we think, especially when we\'ve been thinking something for a long time or it feels very ingrained in our beliefs about ourselves.. But with time and effort, it is possible to change the way we think and how our thought patterns affect us emotionally.. For now, let\'s work on some techniques that might help reduce the frequency or intensity of these intrusive thoughts.."']

head: PersonX seems to think this will make a difference
tail: to be able to help people
literal: Celestino seems to think this will make a difference because Celestino wants to be able to help people.
narrative: Celestino was born with a natural gift for helping people. She always knows just what to say to make someone feel better, and she's always there for her friends when they need her. Her gift has led her to a career in counseling, where she helps people work through their problems every day.
dialogue:
["Sarah, it sounds like you're feeling really overwhelmed and hopeless right now. I can see how that would be really difficult to deal with. Can you tell me more about what's going on for you?"
 "It's just...everything. My job, my family, my life. I don't know how to make it all work and I feel like I'm failing at everything."
 "That sounds really tough. I can see how that would be really discouraging. Can you tell me more about what's going on with your job?"
 "It's just so demanding and I never have enough time for anything else. I'm always behind and feeling like I'm not doing enough."
 "And with your family, is there anything specific that's been going on that's been difficult?"
 "Yes, my mom has been really sick and she's been in the hospital a lot lately. It's just been really hard to see her like that and not be able to do anything to help her."
 "Sarah, it sounds like you're dealing with a lot of difficult things right now. You're carrying a lot of responsibility and you're feeling like you're not doing enough. That can be really tough to handle. Can you tell me more about how you're feeling?"]

head: PersonX enters counseling
literal: Jolette enters counseling. Now Jolette feels sad.
narrative: Jolette enters counseling. Now Jolette feels sadder than he did before because he is finally facing his demons. He opens up about his struggles and starts to work through them with the help of his therapist.
dialogue:
["I'm really struggling right now. I never thought I would be in this place."
 "What's going on?"
 "I just feel so lost and alone. I don't know how to fix things."
 'It sounds like you are feeling hopeless right now.'
 "Yeah, I guess that's it. I feel like there is no way out and things will never get better."
 "Jolette, that doesn't have to be true. You can make things better for yourself. We can work together to help you find a way out of this darkness you are feeling."]

head: PersonX becomes a victim of violence
literal: Lashaun becomes a victim of violence. Now Lashaun seeks counseling.
narrative: Lashaun was walking home from school when he was jumped by a group of kids who beat him up. He sustained some bruises and cuts, and was pretty shaken up. He went to counseling to help him deal with the aftermath of the attack.
dialogue:
["I don't know, I just feel really angry all the time now. I can't stop thinking about what happened, and how those kids just came out of nowhere and attacked me. I keep wondering why they did it, and if they're going to come after me again."
 "It sounds like you're feeling a lot of different emotions right now, which is perfectly normal. It's also common to have a lot of questions after something like this happens. Can you tell me more about why you think you were targeted?"
 "I don't really know. I didn't do anything to them, and I don't even know who they are. But ever since it happened, I feel like I'm being watched everywhere I go. It's like they could show up at any moment and attack me again. And I just hate feeling so helpless and vulnerable all the time."
 "It sounds like you're feeling very scared and alone right now. Have you talked to anyone else about what happened? Family or friends?"
 "No, I haven't really talked to anyone about it. I don't want to worry my family, and I don't really have any close friends who I could talk to about something like this."
 "That's perfectly understandable. It can be very difficult to open up about something like this, even to people who are close to you. But it might be helpful for you to talk to someone who understands what you're going through. Have you thought about talking to a therapist?"]

head: PersonX finds hope and self-esteem in counseling
literal: Noella finds hope and self-esteem in counseling. Now Noella feels happy.
narrative: Noella feels hopeless and has no self-esteem. She goes to counseling and starts to feel happy. She now has hope and her self-esteem is improving.
dialogue:
["I just feel so hopeless and helpless. I don't know what to do with my life."
 "Well, let's explore those feelings a bit, shall we? Tell me more about why you feel that way."
 "I just feel like I'm not good enough for anything. Like no matter what I do, it's never going to be good enough. And I don't see any point in trying because I'll just end up failing anyway."
 'That sounds like quite a lot of self-doubt and negative thinking. Where do you think that might have come from?'
 "I don't know...maybe it's just how I am. But lately it feels like everything is crumbling around me and I can't stop it."
 "It sounds like you're feeling overwhelmed by your circumstances right now. But even though things may be tough, that doesn't mean that you're not capable of handling them or that you're going to fail at everything you try to do. Do you see how your thinking might be contributing to how hopeless and helpless you feel?"
 "Yeah, I guess so...but it's hard to change the way I think when everything in my life seems to be confirmation of my beliefs."
 "That's a valid point. But I wonder if there might be some things in your life that could be viewed in a different light if you chose to see them that way. For example, what are some things that you're good at?"
 "I don't know...I used to be good at art but lately I just can't seem to create anything that I'm happy with."
 "That's too bad. But it sounds like you're not giving yourself credit for your other strengths then. What are some other things that you're good at?"
 "Well, I'm pretty good at math and science. And I've been told that I'm a pretty good listener."
 "There you go! See, you do have other strengths and talents. It's not all about art. And even though you may not be happy with your recent artwork, that doesn't mean you'll never create something that makes you proud again. Just because things are tough right now doesn't mean they'll always be this way. Do you see how your thinking might be contributing to how hopeless and helpless you feel?"
 'Yeah...I guess so. It\'s just hard to change the way I think when everything in my life seems to be confirmation of my beliefs."']

head: PersonX needs counseling
literal: Flora needs counseling. Now Flora feels confused.
narrative: Flora needs counseling because they feel lost and confused. Flora has been struggling recently and has felt like they can't talk to anyone about what's going on. Counseling would give Flora a chance to talk through their feelings and figure out what's going on.
dialogue:
["I don't know what's going on. I feel like I'm lost and confused."
 "It sounds like you've been feeling pretty down lately. Can you tell me more about what's going on?"
 "I just feel like everything is a mess and I don't know how to fix it. I've been talking to people, but it feels like no one really understands what I'm going through."
 "It sounds like you're feeling pretty alone right now. That can be really tough to deal with. Have you been reaching out to people? Trying to connect with them?"
 "Yeah, I've been trying, but it feels like they just don't get it. And even when they do, they don't really know how to help me or what to say. So I end up feeling more alone than ever."
 "That definitely sounds difficult. But it's good that you're reaching out and trying to connect with people, even if it's hard. Maybe we can talk about some ways to make those connections a little easier for you. Would that be okay?"]

head: PersonX gets over the trouble

narrative: Hayle is a young man who is struggling with some personal issues. He decides to seek out counseling to help him work through his problems. After several sessions, Hayle starts to feel better and is able to move on with his life.

head: PersonX becomes an employee

 "I'm doing well, Jaziyah. How are you?"
 "I'm doing great. I love my job here. It's very fulfilling."
 "That's good to hear. We're glad to have you on board. You're doing a great job helping our clients."
 "Thank you. I enjoy helping people who are struggling with their mental health. It's my calling in life."
 "That's great to hear. We need more people like you in the counseling field."]

head: PersonX realizes he is unhappy
literal: Story realizes he is unhappy. Now Story seeks counseling.
narrative: Story seeks counseling to deal with her husband's unhappiness. She discovers that his unhappiness is caused by his feelings of inadequacy and insecurity. Through counseling, Story and her husband are able to work through these issues and improve their relationship.
dialogue:
["I'm so sorry that you're unhappy. What can I do to help?"
 "It's just that I feel like I'm not good enough for you. I know you're successful and independent, and I just feel like I can't measure up."
 "Oh, honey, that's not true at all. I love you just the way you are. You're the one who makes me happy, not anything else."
 "But don't you ever wish I was more like _____? He seems to have it all together."
 "No, sweetie, I don't wish that at all. I love you for being exactly who you are. We complement each other perfectly. Plus, _____ is boring and predictable –I could never be with someone like that!"
 'Story, thank you for understanding me. Just knowing that you accept me for who I am makes me feel so much better.'
 'I will always love and accept you, no matter what.']

head: PersonX receives counseling
literal: Ahsan receives counseling. Now Ahsan wants to stop being depressed.
narrative: Ahsan went to her first counseling session feeling nervous and uncertain. She left the session feeling hopeful and with a plan to work on her depression. Ahsan is determined to stop being depressed and is willing to put in the work to make it happen.
dialogue:
['Counselor: So, how are you feeling today, Ahsan?'
 "A little nervous, I guess. I'm not really sure what to expect from this."
 "That's perfectly understandable. Counseling can be a new and scary experience for people. But I promise you, it can be very helpful in dealing with depression and other mental health issues. So why don't we start by talking about what brings you here today?"
 "Well, I've been feeling really down lately. I just don't have any motivation to do anything and I've been withdrawing from my friends and family. It's just been really hard to get out of bed in the morning and face the day."
 "Depression can be a very debilitating condition. But there are things that we can do to help you feel better. First of all, let's talk about your goals for counseling. What would you like to accomplish through our sessions together?"
 "I guess my main goal is to stop being depressed. I know that sounds kind of simplistic, but that's really what I want. To be able to wake up in the morning and not dread the day ahead. To actually feel like doing things again and being around people again would be amazing."
 'That sounds like a great goal, Ahsan. And it is definitely achievable with some hard work on your part. Let me ask you something – how much effort are you willing to put into getting better? Because recovery from depression takes time and effort, but it is possible if you\'re willing to put in the work."'
 "I'm definitely willing to put in the work. I don't want to be depressed anymore. It's just been so hard lately and I feel like I'm not really living."
 "That's great, Ahsan. determination is key in overcoming depression. So, what do you think are some things that you can do to start feeling better?"
 "Well, I've been doing a lot of research and it seems like exercise and diet are really important in helping with depression. So, I've started going for walks every day and eating healthier foods. And I've also been trying to reach out to my friends and family more, even though it's tough sometimes."
 'Those are all great ideas, Ahsan. It sounds like you have a good plan for taking care of yourself. Just remember to be patient with yourself – recovery from depression takes time. But if you keep up with your self-care plan, you will start to feel better little by little."']

head: PersonX suggests seeking counseling
literal: Graham suggests seeking counseling. Now Graham feels vulnerable.
narrative: Graham suggests that Karen seek counseling. Karen feels defensive and responds that she doesn't need counseling. Graham insists that it might help Karen to talk to someone about her problems.
dialogue:
["Hi, Karen. I hope you're doing well." "I'm fine, thanks."
 "You don't sound fine to me. Is something wrong?"
 "No, nothing's wrong. I just have a lot on my mind lately."
 'Well, maybe you should talk to someone about it. Counseling can be very helpful.'
 "I don't need counseling. I can handle my problems myself."
 "Are you sure? Because it seems to me like you're having a lot of trouble dealing with your problems."
 "I said I don't need counseling! I can deal with my own problems, thank you very much!"
 "Okay, calm down. There's no need to get angry with me. I was just trying to help."
 "Sorry, Graham, but I really don't appreciate being told that I need counseling when I know perfectly well that I don't!"]

head: PersonX talks to a counselor
literal: Daquan talks to a counselor. Now Daquan feels happy.
narrative: Daquan went to her college's counseling center to talk to a counselor about how she was feeling. The counselor was very understanding and helped Daquan feel better about her situation. Now, Daquan feels happy and more confident about herself.
dialogue:
['Hi, I was hoping to talk to someone today.'
 "Hi, Daquan. My name is Mrs. Smith. I'm a counselor here at the college counseling center. How are you doing today?"
 "I'm feeling really down lately. I don't know what's wrong with me."
 "It sounds like you're going through a tough time right now. Do you want to talk about what's going on?"
 "Yeah, I guess so. It's just that everything seems so hard lately. I used to be able to handle things, but now it feels like everything is falling apart."
 "It sounds like you're feeling overwhelmed and like you can't cope with what's going on in your life right now. Is there anything in particular that's been causing you stress?"
 "Well, my grades have been slipping and I'm really worried about failing out of college. And my boyfriend broke up with me last week."
 "It sounds like you've had a lot of changes and stressors in your life recently. That can definitely be overwhelming and difficult to deal with. Let's talk about some ways that you can cope with all of this."]

head: PersonX tries to reconcile
literal: Maryann tries to reconcile. Now Maryann wants to stay married.
narrative: Maryann tries to reconcile with his wife. He tells her that he wants to stay married and work on their relationship. She agrees, and they start attending counseling together.
dialogue:
["I'm sorry for the way I've been acting. I know it's been really hard on you."
 "It has been hard. I don't know if I can trust you anymore."
 "I know. I'm sorry. I really do want to work on our relationship though. I don't want to lose you."
 "Why should I believe you? You've said that before and you always end up going back to your old ways."
 "Because this time is different. I'm willing to do whatever it takes to make things work between us. We've been through a lot together, and I don't want to throw all of that away."
 "Alright, let's give it a try then. But, if you break my trust again, there's no coming back from that."
 'Deal.']

head: PersonX saves PersonY's soul

narrative: At the restaurant, Tyrie told Cade that she had been struggling lately and was thinking about suicide. Cade listened sympathetically and then shared her own story of overcoming suicidal thoughts. She encouraged Tyrie to seek counseling and promised to check in on her frequently.
dialogue:
["So what's been going on? You said you've been struggling?"
 "Yeah, I don't really know what it is. I just feel like I can't do anything right and everything is just so hard. I've been thinking about suicide a lot lately."
 "Oh, Tyrie, I'm so sorry to hear that. I know how you feel. I've been there myself. But you're not alone. There are people who care about you and want to help you through this."
 "Thank you, Cade. It means a lot to me that you understand what I'm going through."
 "Of course, sweetie. We all go through tough times in our lives. But it's important to remember that things can get better. counseling can really help with suicidal thoughts and feelings."
 'Yeah, I think I might need to go talk to someone soon.'
 "Definitely! And if you ever need to talk, please don't hesitate to reach out to me anytime, OK?"
 'OK, thank you so much, Cade']

['Sarah, how are you doing today?'
 'Not too bad, Axell. Just a little stressed out from work.'
 "That's understandable. What's been going on at work that's been stressing you out?"
 "Well, my boss has been giving me a lot of extra assignments and it's just been really overwhelming. I'm starting to feel like I can't keep up."
 "That sounds difficult. Have you talked to your boss about how you're feeling?"
 "No, not yet. I'm afraid that if I do, he'll just give me even more work to do."
 "Well, it might be worth a try to talk to him and see what he says. If nothing else, it will let him know how you're feeling and maybe he'll be more understanding about giving you some extra time to finish your assignments. Sarah, how does that sound?"]

head: PersonX receives counseling
literal: Sai is emotional. Sai receives counseling.
narrative: Sai is emotional because she is receiving counseling. She is going through a tough time and needs someone to talk to.
dialogue:
["I just feel so lost right now. I don't know what to do or where to turn."
 "It sounds like you're feeling very overwhelmed. Can you tell me more about what's going on?"
 "I don't even know where to start. Everything feels like it's falling apart. My job, my relationship, my whole life. I just feel like I'm spinning in circles and I can't get out of it."
 "It sounds like you're feeling like you're in a very dark place right now. But I want you to know that there is hope and there is help available to you. We are here to support you through this tough time."
 "Thank you. Just knowing that I'm not alone in this helps a lot."
 "You're welcome. Would you like to talk about what's going on in your job and relationship? We can explore those areas and see if there are any solutions or coping mechanisms that we can work on together."]

head: PersonX needs counseling
tail: to be able to deal with his problems
literal: Autum needs counseling because Autum wants to be able to deal with his problems.
narrative: Autum needs counseling because he is struggling to deal with his anxiety. He wants to be able to talk to someone about his problems and learn how to manage his anxiety in a healthy way.
dialogue:
["Hi, um, I'm not really sure where to start."
 "That's okay. Why don't you tell me what's been going on?"
 "Well, I've been feeling really anxious lately. It's been interfering with my work and my personal life. I just can't seem to shake it."
 'That sounds tough. Can you tell me more about your anxiety? What are some of the things that trigger it?'
 'Just thinking about things stresses me out. I worry about things that might happen in the future, even though there\'s no reason to think they will actually happen. I get caught up in all of the "what ifs" and it just spirals out of control from there.'
 "It sounds like you're doing a lot of ruminating and catastrophizing. Those are two common patterns of thinking that can contribute to anxiety. Would you like to learn some techniques for how to deal with those thoughts when they come up?"
 'Yes, definitely! That would be great.'
 'Okay, let\'s start with ruminating. This is when you get stuck on a particular thought and can\'t let it go. A lot of times, the thought is something negative or worrying. What we want to do is learn how to "let go" of those thoughts when they come up. One way to do this is called " mindfulness."'
 'What is mindfulness?'
 "Mindfulness means paying attention to the present moment, without judgment. When a worry comes into your head, acknowledge it, but then let it go and focus on something else. It takes practice, but eventually you'll be able to do this more automatically and the worries will have less power over you."
 "That makes sense. I'd like to try that."
 "Great! Another technique that can be helpful for dealing with anxiety is called progressive muscle relaxation. This involves tensing and relaxing different muscle groups in your body, starting with your toes and working your way up to your head. This helps you relax both physically and mentally, and can be very calming when you're feeling anxious."
 'That sounds like something I could definitely use!'
 'Excellent! These are just two of many different techniques that can be helpful for managing anxiety. The important thing is to find what works for you and to keep practicing until it becomes second nature.']

head: PersonX enters counseling
literal: Merlin enters counseling. Now Merlin gets better.
narrative: Merlin enters counseling. He meets with his counselor once a week to talk about his feelings and thoughts. After a few months, Merlin feels better and is able to cope with his problems.
dialogue:
["I'm really feeling a lot better lately. I'm able to cope with my problems and don't feel as overwhelmed as I used to."
 "That's great to hear! It sounds like the counseling is really helping you."
 "Yeah, I think it is. I'm just glad that I finally decided to come and talk to someone about all of this stuff. It's been really helpful."
 "Well, I'm glad that you did too. It sounds like we've made a lot of progress in our sessions together. Do you have any thoughts or questions about what we've talked about so far?"
 "Yeah, I do have a few questions. I'm just not really sure where to start."
 "That's okay. We can take our time and go over anything that you want to talk about."
 "Okay. Well, I was wondering if you could tell me more about how to deal with anxiety? I've been having a lot of trouble with it lately and I'm just not sure what to do."
 "Sure. There are a few different things that you can do to help with anxiety. First, it's important to identify what is causing your anxiety and then try to find ways to reduce or eliminate those factors from your life. Secondly, you can also try some relaxation techniques such as deep breathing or meditation to help reduce the overall level of anxiety that you're feeling. Lastly, it's also important to make sure that you're taking care of yourself physically by getting enough sleep and exercise and eating a healthy diet. Do any of those suggestions sound like something that you would be interested in doing?"
 "Yeah, all of those sound like good ideas. I think I'm going to try some of them out and see if they help me feel better. Thanks for the advice."
 "No problem! Just remember that it's okay to ask for help when you're feeling overwhelmed or anxious. We can work on this together and figure out what works best for you"]

head: PersonX receives counseling
literal: Amar receives counseling. Now Amar feels guilty.
narrative: Amar receives counseling for her anxiety. She feels guilty about going to counseling, thinking that she should be able to deal with her anxiety on her own. After a few sessions, Amar starts to feel better and realizes that counseling was the right decision for her.
dialogue:
["I'm not sure if this is the right decision. I feel like I should be able to deal with my anxiety on my own."
 "It's completely normal to feel this way. Counseling can be a great tool to help you manage your anxiety."
 "I guess I just feel guilty. Like I'm not strong enough to handle this on my own."
 "That's a common misconception about counseling. It doesn't mean that you're weak or that you can't handle your problems on your own. It just means that you're willing to seek out help and learn new tools to manage your anxiety."
 "I suppose you're right. So, what do we do in counseling?"
 "Well, we'll talk about whatever is causing your anxiety and we'll work on developing coping skills and strategies to help you manage your anxiety in a healthy way."]

head: PersonX suggests seeking counseling
literal: Davien suggests seeking counseling. Now Davien feels concerned.
narrative: Davien suggested that Maria seek counseling to help deal with her depression. Davien was concerned because Maria had been acting strangely and he wanted to make sure she got the help she needed.
dialogue:
["Hey, Maria. I've been noticing that you've been acting a bit strange lately. Is everything okay?"
 "No, not really. I'm just feeling really down and depressed."
 "That's understandable. Given what's happened lately, it's only natural to feel that way. But I want to make sure that you're getting the help you need to deal with it. Have you considered counseling?"
 "I don't know...I'm not sure if it would really help me."
 "It can't hurt to try, right? And if nothing else, it'll give you someone to talk to about how you're feeling. I think it would be a good idea for you to at least give it a shot. What do you say?"
 "Alright, Davien. I'll try it."
 "That's great, Maria. I'm sure it'll do you a world of good. Let me know if there's anything I can do to help you, okay?"
 'Okay, Davien. Thanks.']

head: PersonX arranges PersonY's appointment
literal: Benedict arranges Jayson's appointment because Benedict wants to help Jayson.
narrative: Benedict sets up an appointment for Jayson at the counseling center because Benedict is concerned about Jayson's recent behavior. Jayson has been withdrawn and quiet lately, and Benedict wants to make sure she is okay.
dialogue:
['Hey, how are you doing?'
 "I'm alright. Just been feeling a bit down lately."
 "Yeah, I noticed. You've been really quiet and withdrawn. I'm just worried about you, is all."
 "There's nothing to worry about. I'm just going through some stuff right now."
 "Is there anything you want to talk about? I'm here for you, you know."
 "It's just...everything feels so overwhelming right now. I don't know how to deal with it all."
 'Do you want to talk about it? Maybe we could set up an appointment at the counseling center? They could help you sort through everything and figure out a plan on how to deal with it all.'
 'Yeah...I think that might help. Thanks, Benedict.']

head: PersonX refuses to go for counseling
literal: Anaya refuses to go for counseling because Anaya wants to be alone.
narrative: Anaya refused to go for counseling because she wanted to be alone. She didn't want to share her problems with anyone, and she thought she could handle them on her own. Unfortunately, this only made things worse, and she eventually had to seek help from a professional.
dialogue:
["I don't know if this is going to help, but I just can't keep talking to my friends about my problems. They're sick of hearing me complain, and I'm sick of talking about it. Maybe it would be better if I just talk to a stranger about what's going on."
 "Well, hello, Anaya. It sounds like you've been through a lot lately. Why don't we start by telling me your story?"
 "It's just... everything is such a mess right now. My parents are getting divorced, and I feel like I'm stuck in the middle. My friends are all going off to college and moving away, and I'm stuck here at home trying to figure out what I'm supposed to do with my life. It feels like everything is falling apart, and I don't know how to fix it."
 "That does sound very difficult. Can you tell me more about how you're feeling?"
 "I just feel so lost and alone right now. Like everyone is moving on with their lives and leaving me behind. It's like I'm stuck in this holding pattern while everyone else is moving forward. And sometimes I just feel so hopeless that things will ever get better."
 "Those are all very normal feelings to have in your situation, Anaya. But it sounds like you're really struggling right now. Have you been thinking about harming yourself in any way?"
 "No, I would never do that. But sometimes I just feel like giving up and disappearing. Like maybe it would be better if I just didn't exist anymore."
 "Anaya, it's normal to feel like that sometimes, but you have to remember that those thoughts are only temporary. They're not going to last forever. And harming yourself is never the answer."
 "I know that. But it's just so hard right now. I feel like I'm stuck in this dark place and I can't find my way out."
 "That's a very common feeling, Anaya. But you have to remember that there is always hope. Things can and will get better, but you have to be patient and give yourself time to heal."
 "I guess you're right... It's just so hard to see the light when everything feels so dark right now."
 "Yes, it is difficult, but you have to trust that things will get better in time. Just take things one day at a time and focus on taking care of yourself both physically and emotionally. If you need any help or support, please don't hesitate to reach out for help from a professional or your friends and family members"]

head: PersonX meets a counselor

He felt lost and alone, and wasn't sure how to move on with his life. The counselor provided him with support and guidance, helping him to see that he was not alone and that there was hope for the future.
dialogue:
["I can't believe it's over. I loved her so much."
 "I'm sorry to hear that, Kyliee. What happened?"
 "We just couldn't make things work. We fought all the time and it just tore us apart."
 "That sounds really tough. It's normal to feel lost and alone after a break-up. But it's important to remember that there is hope for the future. You will find someone else who makes you happy."
 "I don't know if I can ever trust anyone again. I just feel so betrayed right now."
 "Betrayal is a difficult thing to deal with, but it doesn't mean that you should give up on love altogether. There are people out there who will love and appreciate you for who you are, not what you can do for them or how much money you make. Just keep your heart open and don't give up hope, okay?"
 "Yeah, I guess you're right. Thanks for listening. It really helped to talk to you."
 'Anytime, Kyliee. Remember, we are here for you.']

head: PersonX receives counseling
literal: Zella receives counseling. Now Zella feels ashamed.
narrative: Zella feels ashamed after she receives counseling. She feels like she is the only one who has problems and that everyone else is better off than her.
dialogue:
["I just feel so ashamed. I feel like I'm the only one who has problems and that everyone else is better off than me."
 'Zella, what makes you feel that way?'
 "I don't know. It just seems like everyone else has their life together and they're not struggling like I am."
 "Zella, it's normal to feel like that sometimes. We all have our own struggles and nobody is perfect. You are not alone in feeling this way."
 'But why does it seem like everyone else has it all together? What am I doing wrong?'
 "There is no one right or wrong way to live your life, we all make our own choices and decisions. Some people may appear to have everything together on the outside, but that doesn't mean they don't have struggles on the inside. Just because someone appears to be happy and content doesn't mean they don't have any problems at all. Everyone goes through tough times, even if it doesn't seem like it from the outside looking in."
 "I guess you're right. I just feel so alone sometimes."
 "That's understandable. It can be hard to open up and share our struggles with others, but it's important to remember that we all have them. You are not alone in feeling this way."]

 "That sounds great! It sounds like you're really committed to making changes in your life. Keep up the good work and don't be afraid to reach out if you need any support along the way."]

As a result, Lashay continues to suffer from her mental health issues, which often cause her to feel isolated, anxious, and depressed.
dialogue:
["I don't think I need to go to counseling. I can handle my mental health on my own."

 "It's okay to be scared, but counseling can really help. It's a safe place where you can talk about whatever is going on in your life."

 "Lashay, please reconsider. I really think it would help you to talk to someone about what's going on."]

 "It sounds like you're feeling a lot of anger and betrayal right now. Those are natural reactions to what happened, but it's important to try and work through those feelings so they don't consume you. Trust is a very important part of any relationship, so it's understandable that you would feel upset after what happened. Have you talked to him about how you're feeling?"
 "No, I haven't. I don't even want to talk to him anymore. I'm just so hurt and angry right now."
 "It's understandable that you don't want to talk to him right now, but it might be helpful in the long run to try and communicate with him about what happened. It could help you both understand each other's perspective better and potentially help rebuild that trust between you two. What do you think? Would you be willing to give it a try?"]

head: PersonX drives his or her partner crazy
literal: Gina drives his or her partner crazy. Now Gina wants to stop.
narrative: Gina's partner has had enough of Gina's constant nagging and complaining. Gina wants to change, but doesn't know how. Gina's partner suggests counseling to help work on their communication.
dialogue:
["I'm really not sure why my partner suggested counseling. I mean, things aren't that bad between us, are they?"
 "Well, Gina, it sounds like your partner is feeling overwhelmed by your constant nagging and complaining. They may feel like they can't win with you no matter what they do. Counseling can help you learn how to communicate more effectively so that you can resolve conflict in a healthier way."
 "I see. I guess I can understand why my partner would feel that way. I don't mean to be a nag, it's just that sometimes I feel like I'm not being heard. And when things don't go my way, it's hard not to lash out."
 "It sounds like you're feeling frustrated because you feel like your needs aren't being met. Can you tell me more about that? What are some specific examples?"
 "Well, for instance, my partner never seems to want to spend time with me anymore. We used to go on dates and do things together all the time, but now it feels like they're always busy with work or other things. I know they're busy, but I can't help feeling like I'm not a priority anymore."
 "It sounds like you're feeling neglected and unimportant to your partner. Have you talked to them about how you're feeling?"
 "Yeah, I have. But it feels like they just brush me off and say they're too busy. I know they care about me, but it's hard when I feel like I'm always last on their list."
 "Gina, it sounds like you're feeling really hurt and alone right now. Have you considered taking a break from your relationship? Just for a little while so that you can focus on yourself and your own needs?"
 "Yeah, that's actually something we've been talking about lately. I think some time apart might be good for us right now."
 'That sounds like a good idea, Gina. Taking some time apart can be really helpful in giving both of you some space to figure out what you want and need from the relationship. If you decide to come back together after some time apart, counseling can still be beneficial in helping you learn how to communicate more effectively so that you can avoid conflict in the future.']

head: PersonX avoids seeing a counselor
literal: Chioma avoids seeing a counselor because Chioma wants to avoid counseling.
narrative: Chioma thinks that counseling is a waste of time because it's just a bunch of people sitting around talking about their problems. She thinks that she can figure out her own problems without needing to talk to anyone else about them.
dialogue:
["I don't think counseling is worth it. It's just a bunch of people sitting around talking about their problems."
 "I disagree. I think counseling can be very helpful. It's a chance to talk to someone who is objective and can help you see things from a different perspective."
 "I don't need to talk to anyone else about my problems. I can figure them out on my own."
 "But sometimes it's helpful to have someone else to talk to, especially if you're feeling lost or stuck. Counseling can provide you with the tools you need to deal with your problems in a healthy way."
 "I'm not sure...I don't know if I'm ready to open up like that."
 "That's okay, there's no pressure to do anything you're not comfortable with. Counseling is all about taking things at your own pace and finding what works for you."]
